title: Data & Analytics Operations Lead
job_summary: Familiarity with data technologies, tools, and processes, such as data engineering, data science, data visualization, and analytics.
job_description:
Position Title: Data & Analytics Operations Lead

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 22100

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people's lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values. McCain has recently committed to implementing regenerative agriculture practices across 100 percent of our potato acreage by 2030. Ask us more about our commitment to sustainability.

OVERVIEW

Our Technology team's goal is to inspire growth through innovative technology experiences. McCain is embarking on an ambitious digital transformation across our business from Agriculture to Manufacturing to Customers and Consumers. As part of this transformation, we are making significant investments into our data systems and building digital products for our customers, key suppliers and McCain team members to enable digital processes and data-driven automation over time. Through our investments, we will transform McCain to be a place that empowers our teams with easy-to-use tools and inspired analytics.

We are currently recruiting an Operations Lead to join the leadership team of our Digital & Data team and reporting to the Vice-President Digital & Data. This role will work with our Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists to drive the delivery of the highest-priority projects in Data & Analytics, serving as a point person for our team's most critical deliverables. This role is also a key contributor to the Digital & Data strategy, supporting the Digital & Data leadership team to drive strategic priorities at pace. If you are a motivated and collaborative individual with a passion for agile methodologies and data-driven decision making, this role is for you!

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Act as a coach to the Data & Analytics delivery teams, by demonstrating Agile ceremonies including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives for select Data & Analytics projects and coaching delivery leads to hold Agile ceremonies in their own teams
Provide guidance and support to team members on Agile principles and practices, helping them to continuously improve their processes and deliverables.
Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment, ensuring that team members have the necessary resources, tools, and information to achieve their goals.
Help the team to identify and remove any obstacles or impediments that may affect their progress or productivity, including data-related challenges, technical dependencies, and stakeholder engagement.
Collaborate with product owners, data stakeholders, and business partners in our digital & data teams to ensure that Product Owners in data and analytics are properly refining and prioritizing their backlogs, and that sprint goals are aligned with business objectives.
Monitor and track team progress and performance using Agile metrics, and provide regular status updates to stakeholders and leadership.
Encourage a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, and facilitate knowledge sharing and learning across the team.
Stay up-to-date with Agile best practices and industry trends, and proactively identify opportunities to optimize Agile processes and methodologies within the Data & Analytics team.

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as Data Science, Computer Science, or related field, or equivalent work experience.
At least 3 years of prior experience in Consulting, or Project Management
Proven experience working as a Project Manager or Operations Lead in an Agile, technology delivery environment, preferably with data and analytics teams (Scrum master certification preferred)
Excellent facilitation, coaching, and mentoring skills, with the ability to build relationships and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with data technologies, tools, and processes, such as data engineering, data science, data visualization, and analytics. (Azure stack preferred)
Understanding of the role and importance of Data Governance practice to effective Data Analytics.
Demonstrated ability to identify and address team dynamics, conflicts, and challenges in a constructive manner.
Experience with Agile tools such as Azure DevOps or Jira
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically, with a data-driven mindset.
Self-motivated and able to work independently, with a proactive and results-oriented mindset.
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger.
McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

The health and safety of McCain employees and their families has been our number one priority since the start of COVID-19 pandemic. With vaccination restrictions easing across the globe we do not currently require employees to be vaccinated, but we reserve the right to change this mandate in line with health guidance and regulations in each country.
Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy

job_description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

Metro Supply Chain is a strategic supply chain solutions partner for some of the world’s fastest growing and most recognizable organizations. We advance our customers’ business through innovative, real-world solutions within a culture that supports our communities, protects our environment, and enables our team to thrive. Managing 14 million square feet in 98 sites across North America and Europe with a team of 6,000, it is the largest privately-owned supply chain solutions company based in Canada.

The Supply Chain Analytics team at Metro has one mandate - drive change through data.

Analytics in Supply Chain:
As per Deloitte, supply chains are a rich place to look for competitive advantage, partly because of their complexity, and partly because of the significant role they play in a company’s cost structure. With the power of new analytics, companies can now fine-tune their supply chains in ways that simply weren’t possible in the past. As a supply chain company analytics and insights are everything!
Based on this, Metro Supply Chain is embracing and driving change which is critical to our success. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and attracting the best talent to drive the company forward.
The successful candidate will support the design and delivery of analytics and insights to customers, operations, and senior leadership. They will bring decision, descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to life to support operational performance reviews and continuous improvement efforts.
At Metro we focus on efficiency, effectiveness, people, and financial metrics to drive change and improve prediction and planning.

A small sample of what you will be involved in:
Produce insightful business analytics related to the distribution centres, transportation, contract packaging, and time critical teams.
Using customer data to visualize, analyze, and simplify the performance picture it is not just boxes going from point A to point B.
Work proactively with key business partners to identify opportunities and to drive transformational business growth initiatives, which deliver customer and shareholder value and meet targets as agreed with company senior leadership.

Who you are:
A high performing and motivated individual who is:Creative, agile, and innovative, able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help shape our evolving strategy through building, launching, and managing initiatives/strategies producing results for our organization and customer.Effective communication style with a demonstrated ability to work with teams.A natural leader, leading by example and not afraid of questioning the norm and changing behaviours.Strategic thinker with strong execution skillsProblem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectivesA strong business acumen and thrives on bringing data and numbers to life with excellent analytical and visualization skillsProject management masteryHumble intelligence and confidenceGreat attitude and demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on capacityAbility to have fun, work hard and make a difference
Qualifications:
University/College degree in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, or related field5+ years of relevant and demonstrable experience in the business intelligence and analytics field and 3+ years of experience in a leadership role as this is a hands-on role.Coding skills in languages such as, SQL (must-have) and PySpark/ Python (preferred)Strong understanding in SQL programming language and cloud-based platforms (Azure, Snowflake, others)Ability to work on data science tools (R, Python, Apache Spark, others) is preferred.Understanding of data pipelines and ETL (extract, transform, load) processes.Expert knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI (must-have)Ability to work with IT and Data Engineering teams to help embed analytic outputs in business processes.Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics/technology projects.Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written. Able to engage and effectively manage relationships at all levels of the organization.Experience in supply chain or transportation industry is a plus.
Why Join Us
Work in an environment where safety is our first priorityThe opportunity to build a career with a growing companyMedical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your familyLife and disability insuranceWellness programs to support your family’s well-beingA Retirement Savings Program with a company matchCompany team wear allowanceEmployee Appreciation DayCompany sponsored social eventsCommunity volunteering
We are committed to building and fostering a diverse workplace where people feel included and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
Should you require accommodation for a special ability or need during the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of our Human Resources Team.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Product
job_summary: 4+ years of experience in data science, analytics or economics. Design and analyze experiments and other tests for causal inference, in collaboration with…
job_description:
A home is the biggest investment most people make, and yet, it doesn't come with a manual. That's why we're building the only app homeowners need to effortlessly manage their homes — knowing what to do, when to do it, and who to hire. With Thumbtack, millions of people care for what matters most, and pros earn billions of dollars through our platform. And as one of the fastest-growing companies in a $600B+ industry — we must be doing something right.

We are driven by a common goal and the deep satisfaction that comes from knowing our work supports local economies, helps small businesses grow, and brings homeowners peace of mind. We're seeking people who continually put our purpose first: advocating for pros and customers, embracing change, and choosing teamwork every day.

At Thumbtack, we're creating a new era of home care. If making an impact and the chance to do good inspires you, join us. Imagine what we'll build together.

Thumbtack by the Numbers

Available nationwide in all 3,143 U.S. counties
75 million projects started on Thumbtack
4 million customers in the last 12 months
Pros earn billions on our platform
More than 9 million 5-star reviews for our stellar pros
1000+ employees and $3.2 billion valuation (June, 2021)

About the Data Science Team

The Data Science team empowers Thumbtack to use data to guide business decisions. We collaborate with partners across the company to solve the most analytically challenging problems - everything from informing how we set prices across almost a thousand local services categories, to evaluating the impact of a new business model on company performance, to identifying early predictors of high-quality customers. We are a tight-knit, intellectually curious team that is committed to improving Thumbtack and improving each other.

About the Role

Data Scientists at Thumbtack are empowered early on to leverage their critical thinking, interpersonal, and technical skills to make a positive impact on the company. Data Scientist embed with product teams to support new product feature launches, study the economics of our massive and dynamic marketplace, and help inform strategy. As a Data Scientist, you'll be the person responsible for all the analytical needs of an entire team of engineers, designers, and product/marketing managers - helping empower the team and Thumbtack more broadly to build the best product, as quickly as possible.

Responsibilities
Propose and conduct quantitative research into key user behaviors, product flows, and business trends; based on analysis and in collaboration with cross-functional partners, identify potential new opportunities and next steps for the product team
Design and analyze experiments and other tests for causal inference, in collaboration with engineers, applied scientist, and economists
Partner with product managers, engineers, etc. to help scope new features, e.g., scenario modeling for possible impact on key metrics, make recommendations on business logic of new features, etc.
Define and monitor key metrics; investigate changes in metrics and propose next steps
Develop topic area expertise, e.g., develop a deep understanding of how Thumbtack search works and interacts with other systems
Contribute to our team and company data culture through accessible data table design and maintenance
Collaborate with, mentor, and help recruit team members

What you'll need

If you don't think you meet all of the criteria below but still are interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.

4+ years of experience in data science, analytics or economics
Experience managing stakeholders with competing priorities in areas such as Product Management, Design, Engineering and Marketing
Experience scoping, analyzing, and communicating results of experiments
Expert in SQL
Strong communication skills and ability to build strong relationships cross-functionally and with leadership

title: Technology Specialist - Machine Learning
job_summary: As a Technology Specialist - Machine Learning (ML), you will be a technical solution expert within our worldwide Artificial Intelligence (AI) commercial…
job_description:
As a Technology Specialist - Machine Learning (ML), you will be a technical solution expert within our worldwide Artificial Intelligence (AI) commercial solution area organization working with strategic customers on establishing their AI Strategy. Specifically, you will lead strategic technical customer engagements that will require you to deliver architectural design sessions, pilots for ML Platforms, Proof of concept (PoC) ML model development, developing custom foundational models, and advising on best-practices for Enterprise Machine Learning systems. You’ll create Generative AI-powered applications that are enhanced by the broader AI portfolio, with the goal of demonstrating the value of a business use case for your customers. You will collaborate with a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the decision process and increase the adoption of the Azure and AI services, specifically Machine Learning and AI Infrastructure, within your customer accounts. You will work within your team as a subject matter expert to help customers derive value through AI.

This role sits in our Global Black Belt (GBB) organization, which is a team of highly specialized and technical professionals within our Microsoft Customer & Partner Solutions organization (MCAPS) who work with customers to enable some of the most complex and innovative solutions, providing differentiated technical leadership and guidance along the way. The AI team within the GBB organization consists of Specialist and Technology experts, who focus on specific domains, industries, and workloads, such as Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Services, Application Development and Machine Learning.

This role will require travel to customer sites.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities
Winning new AzureML engagements via solution expertise proving technical and business value via workshops (1:1, 1: many) that drive commitment for minimum viable product (MVP) for business and technical decision makers showcasing Machine Learning capability.
Work with the solution specialist team to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections, and develop the strategy to resolve technical blockers.
Provide in-depth ML and Deep Learning expertise to support the technical relationship with Azure customers, including product and solution briefings, creating demos, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Azure Machine Learning and AI optimized infrastructure.
Recommend integration strategies, enterprise architectures, platforms, and application infrastructure required to successfully implement a complete solution using best practices on Azure AI. This includes end-to-end ML Flow processes leveraging AzureML.
Support developers, creators, and enterprises to leverage open source and in-house developed ML/Deep Learning models so they can build their own AI products in the future.
Be a trusted advisor to our top customers, helping them understand and incorporate AI/ML accelerators into their overall cloud strategy by recommending migration paths, integration strategies, and application architecture that incorporate Azure AI optimized infrastructure.
Demonstrate how Azure Machine Learning is differentiated, highlighting the power of accelerators by working with customers on POCs, demonstrating features, optimizing model performance, profiling, and benchmarking.
Identify and assess large scale ML and Deep Learning opportunities that would benefit from AI optimized infrastructure. You will help customers leverage accelerators within their overall cloud strategy by helping run benchmarks for existing models, finding opportunities to use accelerators for new models, developing migration paths, and helping to analyze cost to performance.
Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications:
6+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 4+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND 3+ years of technical pre-sales or technical consulting experience
OR equivalent experience.
AI Experience: 3+ years of AI (Machine Learning, Deep Learning) solution positioning experience in enterprise public cloud-based solutions, working in Azure ML or with a equivalent compete cloud Machine Learning platform.

Additional or Preferred Qualifications:
Solution Positioning Experience: 3+ years of experience with managing implementation lifecycle for delivery technology solutions. Work experience should involve presales support, risk management, technical consulting, solution design, project envisioning, planning, development, deployment, and management. Qualified Data Scientist or ML Engineer with proven customer facing consultative skills.
Experience with AI Models, Large Language Models (LLM), and AI specialized infrastructure especially as it relates to AI trends and issues within businesses. This includes: Open-source models, Hugging Face Hub Community collection and fine-tuning Azure OpenAI Service models.
Experience with Responsible AI, in practice or theory.
Familiarity with core machine learning concepts, including infrastructure and open-source options (ex: compute systems - GPU & FPGA, AI/ML frameworks – TensorFlow, MLflow, JAX & PyTorch, tools - Jupyter notebooks & VS Code, etc.)
Certifications with Azure Data, Azure AI or equivalent industry certifications

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Senior Manager, Analytics – Stores & Services
job_summary: This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven…
job_description:
: 1258494

Who we are
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable, and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team

Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven organization. The individual will lead the Reporting & Insights practice for Stores & Services as part of the Enterprise Analytics & Data Science team. Our multi-tenant cloud platforms power our analytics and ML/AI capabilities and we’re looking for an active hands-on contributor to play a central role in helping our teams understand performance and impact of their strategies. Additionally, the role will be continuously challenged to bring forward valuable insights to help their partners make better and more informed decisions.

We’re on a transformation journey and this role will be a key enabler in accelerating our analytics practice. In addition to having direct ownership over Stores & Services, this role will work closely with various cross-functional partners and have the opportunity to build deep insights across the customer journey – extending to marketing, supply chain, and our B2B functions.

This position represents an ideal role for a highly motivated and highly analytical individual. We are a highly collaborative, agile work environment, so the ideal candidate would demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and excellent technical depth. The successful candidate will be passionate about data and have a strong foundation in analytics, understanding business needs, and storytelling.

Specifically, You Will:
Strategy & Enablement:
Establish the company as the leader in leveraging and executing on a customer first data-driven strategyOwn and develop the vision, strategy, and execution for a best-in-class customer intelligence and analytics function, ensuring scalability of systems, governance, tools, capabilities, processes, and talentWork with other functions within Analytics and Engineering to curate and source together transactional/behavioural/operational data (in-store, online, third-party) into views that can easily be leveraged and trusted for decision making, connecting back to our customer, their journeys and business prioritiesDevelop suite of reporting tools, with a self-serve enablement focus, that define business impact and project success, while also providing deep insights on integrated data sets to evaluate short term and long-term ROIDrive both strategic and tactical execution to unlock the value of data across internal and external data sets and generate critical actionable insights to drive the decision-making processEstablish analytical standards and best practices to be leveraged across the company’s ecosystem
Delivery of the Functional Analytics Roadmap:
Execute on the roadmap and deliver reporting & impactful insights to core partners across Retail Operations and Services (online and stores)Provide business insights and recommendations to drive increased revenue, conversion, traffic, profitability, and an improved customer experience. Implement quick wins to support the overall business objectivesOversee performance and operational reporting, ad-hoc analysis, and project ROI determination for core stakeholder groups, including manage ongoing reporting and business scorecards for corporate and field teamsDetermine business needs and the right KPIs for new projects/enhancements and deliver a crisp narrative on its outcome post-launchWork closely with partners to determine how to further leverage analytics, addressing their unique needs for insights in a scalable mannerDeliver a common reporting service layer between various back end and front-end data across all BUs enabling streamlined self-serve reportingLeverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of business functionsFocus on automation and utilizing technology to provide repeatable solutions; drive optimization and efficiency initiatives to support reduced cycle time and automation across existing workflows
Collaboration & Cross-Functional Thought Leadership:
Build partnerships throughout the organization to champion the voice for Stores & Services, and elevate the conversation around Analytics within the functionDrive, mentor, and motivate the organization to focus on continuous analytics excellence and the delivery of information and insights to the business’s key stakeholdersEngage broadly within the Staples Canada organization to communicate wins and to identify potential opportunities to consider; enable all analysts to be empowered in using all types of dataPartner with Marketing, Merchandising, and other teams to bring forward solutions to accelerate their roadmaps, enabling us all to move faster and further together
Team:
Mentor team to be a best-in class analytics functionMotivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a culture where individuals are motivated, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support to the wider organization
Some of what you need:
BS / BA, preferably in Mathematics or Computer sciences or any other quantitative discipline5-7 years in a highly analytical, results-driven environment3+ years of experience specifically in retail data management and analyticsDemonstrated retail experience working with stores & online datasetsExceptional analytical and critical thinking skills; ability for translating large, complex datasets and digesting them into actionable business insights that have an impactProven ability to collaborate broadly with flexible, positive attitude and ability to get resultsExceptional oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate to the senior executive level and identify the strategic opportunities behind your analysisAbility to manage large datasets and being open and eager to use new tools; experience with Looker, PowerBI, or any Business Intelligence toolsExpert in SQLProficiency with statistical tools such as SAS or R an assetUnderstanding of the Google Cloud Platform or other cloud-based data platforms
Some of what you will get:
Associate discountHealth and Dental benefitsRRSP/DPSPPerformance bonusesLearning & Development programsAnd more...

title: Analytics Lead
job_summary: Understanding of data pipelines and ETL (extract, transform, load) processes. Expert knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI (must-have)…
job_description:
JOIN OUR TEAM

Metro Supply Chain is a strategic supply chain solutions partner for some of the world’s fastest growing and most recognizable organizations. We advance our customers’ business through innovative, real-world solutions within a culture that supports our communities, protects our environment, and enables our team to thrive. Managing 14 million square feet in 98 sites across North America and Europe with a team of 6,000, it is the largest privately-owned supply chain solutions company based in Canada.

The Supply Chain Analytics team at Metro has one mandate - drive change through data.

Analytics in Supply Chain:
As per Deloitte, supply chains are a rich place to look for competitive advantage, partly because of their complexity, and partly because of the significant role they play in a company’s cost structure. With the power of new analytics, companies can now fine-tune their supply chains in ways that simply weren’t possible in the past. As a supply chain company analytics and insights are everything!
Based on this, Metro Supply Chain is embracing and driving change which is critical to our success. As such we are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and attracting the best talent to drive the company forward.
The successful candidate will support the design and delivery of analytics and insights to customers, operations, and senior leadership. They will bring decision, descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics to life to support operational performance reviews and continuous improvement efforts.
At Metro we focus on efficiency, effectiveness, people, and financial metrics to drive change and improve prediction and planning.

A small sample of what you will be involved in:
Produce insightful business analytics related to the distribution centres, transportation, contract packaging, and time critical teams.
Using customer data to visualize, analyze, and simplify the performance picture it is not just boxes going from point A to point B.
Work proactively with key business partners to identify opportunities and to drive transformational business growth initiatives, which deliver customer and shareholder value and meet targets as agreed with company senior leadership.

Who you are:
A high performing and motivated individual who is:Creative, agile, and innovative, able to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help shape our evolving strategy through building, launching, and managing initiatives/strategies producing results for our organization and customer.Effective communication style with a demonstrated ability to work with teams.A natural leader, leading by example and not afraid of questioning the norm and changing behaviours.Strategic thinker with strong execution skillsProblem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectivesA strong business acumen and thrives on bringing data and numbers to life with excellent analytical and visualization skillsProject management masteryHumble intelligence and confidenceGreat attitude and demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on capacityAbility to have fun, work hard and make a difference
Qualifications:
University/College degree in Data Science/Analytics, Engineering, or related field5+ years of relevant and demonstrable experience in the business intelligence and analytics field and 3+ years of experience in a leadership role as this is a hands-on role.Coding skills in languages such as, SQL (must-have) and PySpark/ Python (preferred)Strong understanding in SQL programming language and cloud-based platforms (Azure, Snowflake, others)Ability to work on data science tools (R, Python, Apache Spark, others) is preferred.Understanding of data pipelines and ETL (extract, transform, load) processes.Expert knowledge of data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI (must-have)Ability to work with IT and Data Engineering teams to help embed analytic outputs in business processes.Proven track record of delivering impactful analytics/technology projects.Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written. Able to engage and effectively manage relationships at all levels of the organization.Experience in supply chain or transportation industry is a plus.
Why Join Us
Work in an environment where safety is our first priorityThe opportunity to build a career with a growing companyMedical, dental, and vision coverage for you and your familyLife and disability insuranceWellness programs to support your family’s well-beingA Retirement Savings Program with a company matchCompany team wear allowanceEmployee Appreciation DayCompany sponsored social eventsCommunity volunteering
We are committed to building and fostering a diverse workplace where people feel included and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
Should you require accommodation for a special ability or need during the recruitment process, please reach out to a member of our Human Resources Team.

title: Scientist II - Data Extraction - CMD & GI
job_summary: Apply subject matter expertise on projects within the Cardiometabolic disease (CMD) TA, working with scientists across different TAs to ensure the scientific…
job_description:
We are seeking a Scientist II to join our Customer Therapeutics Team. Reporting to the Customer Therapeutic Area (TA) Lead - CMD & GI, this role involves close collaboration with an array of professionals including Scientists, Scientific Liaisons, and our Go-To-Market, Product, Data, and Discovery teams. Responsibilities will span a variety of areas: supporting customer proof of concept case studies through data extraction and analysis on the ASCEND applications, identifying enhancement opportunities for these applications, demonstrating the impact of our technology to our clientele, detecting and addressing data gaps, and aiding in the creation of innovative solutions. This position requires a scientifically rigorous professional with excellent problem-solving skills, technical data analysis skills, and a commitment to continuous improvement in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. Your contribution will be pivotal to our mission of utilizing technology to improve therapeutic outcomes.

BenchSci is a remote-first organization. At this moment, we are welcoming applicants from Canada, and the US for this position.

You Will:
Apply subject matter expertise on projects within the Cardiometabolic disease (CMD) TA, working with scientists across different TAs to ensure the scientific accuracy of data, and ensure timely and impactful deliverables are aligned with customer needs
Use SQL and Excel to generate insights from large datasets and identify opportunities to increase data depth, breadth, and accuracy
Identify gaps in underlying data and product offerings and provide reports and recommendations to address these, in collaboration with Data and Product teams
Work with Go-to-Market to understand customer commitments, and to design strategies for demonstrating the capacity of the ASCEND platform
Keep up with current biomedical research to guide technology development, and ensure the platform is up to date with current trends within that therapeutic area, including performing therapeutic health assessments

You Have:
Experience in the field of CMD with 3+ years of research experience is a must PhD or MSc.
3+ years of relevant bench experience in the biological sciences (Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Pharmacology, or relevant fields)
Experience using SQL, Python and/or R to access, extract, and assess data from large datasets
Ability to solve open-ended tasks and develop data-driven solutions to novel problems
Demonstrated ability to work across different teams and be an effective team member
Proficiency in articulating scientific insights clearly and effectively to both specialized experts and non-specialized stakeholders within and outside the organization
Capability to pivot and act on process improvements when required
High level of organization, time management, project management, and attention to detail

Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.
About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen
Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Personal Competencies:
Delivers results. Works tenaciously toward and derives satisfaction from achieving challenging goals; pitches in where required without regard to status. Self-disciplined; measures progress and evaluates results; prevents irrelevant issues or distractions from interfering with the timely completion of important initiatives.
Interpersonal skills. Demonstrates clear, professional, and respectful communication in all interactions, consistent with an inclusive work environment. Treats others with dignity and respect. The team isn't just better for having you; the others are better by having you
Pursues excellence. Dedicates required time and energy to assignments or tasks to ensure that no aspect of the work is neglected; works to overcome obstacles to completing tasks or assignments. Raises the bar, and helps others reach it too.
Applied learning. Readily absorbs and comprehends new information from formal and informal learning experiences.
Embraces change. Actively tries to understand changes in work tasks, situations, and environment as well as the logic or basis for change; actively seeks information about new work situations.
Teamwork and collaboration. Adheres to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfils team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.

VGW Canada Inc. is committed to building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workplace. By learning from each other's differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. title: Sr. Data Analyst
job_summary: Write scripts to process/massage/correlate the data collected from one or more data sources and store them in the enterprise RDBMS (MS-SQL) system.
job_description:
413206BR
Technology Solutions
Mississauga, ON
July 10, 2023

Company Overview

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

Department Overview

Network Operations – is a group under Core Infrastructure Technology Solutions. The group is responsible for supporting TD Banks enterprise Network 24×7, resolving simple to complex incident and providing KPI metrics & Data analysis around performance and plan capacity for the network infrastructure. The team is also responsible to drive automation for resolving simple, repeatable incidents and do proactive monitoring of network devices.

Job Description

This role is responsible to develop /maintain automation systems that provides Network performance and capacity, trends and usage pattern reporting, from the KPI metrics data collected from multiple network management tools. Setup/maintain scripts to perform automated health check on Network devices and analyze the Incident data to provide different insights that will help identify potential opportunities

Ability to use programming languages, scripting and database query languages will be required for data preparation, collection and distribution.
Collaboration with network analysts / other automation teams to gather business requirements, identify opportunities for integrating different data sources, document the requirements and expected outcome and finally develop the automation workflow.
Additionally, dashboards and analysis workbooks will be delivered with analytics tools like Tableau, to assist in messaging and reporting of the various KPI metrics to consumers.

Responsibilities:
Work with the team of Network Analysts and Performance/capacity SMEs to understand current data collection method, Tools used and document requirements.
Identify opportunities to automate the manual workflows, health checks, data collections and reporting/distribution.
Understand API / Scripting interfaces available in various network infrastructure devices & systems like Service Now and identify the best method to extract the required data.
Create and maintain workflows & dashboard in systems like Confluence and Jira.
Work with the Tools Strategy and Product Management teams to ensure scripting and associated documentations are done as per the defined standards.
Write scripts to process/massage/correlate the data collected from one or more data sources and store them in the enterprise RDBMS (MS-SQL) system.
Use different data sources (excel/Database) in Tableau desktop to create presentation dashboards as per the requirements.
Document and cross train the team to maintain the scripts and the Tableau Dashboards.

Requirements

4-6+ years of experience in the following areas.

Must have experience with one or more of the following programming, scripting, automation and query languages – Powershell, R, Python, REST, JSON, XML
Must have experience with MS SQL / SQL languages for data extraction, manipulation and distribution of datasets and analysis results
Ability to collect data from tools and Network infrastructure devices using programming and scripting.
Experience working in large enterprise and coordination with multiple internal / external groups to complete the assigned task.
Ability to work with network engineers and quickly understand their data collection / Presentation requirements.
Must be strong is using Power Bi & Tableau to correlate multiple data sources and crate dashboard using the given logic to create effective presentation views.
Very strong RDBMS skills in MS-SQL to organize / massage / store the data collected.
Experience in scripting or advanced tools like SQL extraction, Data Mining, etc. will also be considered a plus
Experience with Bitbucket, Confluence and Jira Enterprise best practices and standards, documentation skills.
Strong MS-Office skills (Word, Excel and Powerpoint)
Soft skills – working with people and resolving conflicts.

Additional Information

Join in on what others in TD Technology Solutions are doing:
Inspire a positive work environment and help champion quality, innovation, teamwork and service to the business.
Learn voraciously, stretch your thinking,

Hours
37.5

Inclusiveness

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Data Scientist - II (Contract)
job_summary: Work with large datasets, perform data analysis, and develop data pipelines to support model development. 3+ years of experience as a data scientist, preferably…
job_description:
At Netomi AI, we are on a mission to create artificial intelligence that builds customer love for the world’s largest global brands.

Some of the largest brands are already using Netomi AI’s platform to solve mission-critical problems. This would allow you to work with top-tier clients at the senior level and build your network.

Backed by the world’s leading investors such as Y-Combinator, Index Ventures, Jeffrey Katzenberg (co-founder of DreamWorks) and Greg Brockman (co-founder & President of OpenAI/ChatGPT), you will become a part of an elite group of visionaries who are defining the future of AI for customer experience. We are building a dynamic, fast growing team that values innovation, creativity, and hard work. You will have the chance to significantly impact the company’s success while developing your skills and career in AI.

Want to become a key part of the Generative AI revolution? We should talk.

Do you believe in the missions of intelligence agencies? Are you interested in building state-of-the-art NLP models and solving complex technical challenges? Do you want to be a part of our journey in shaping the future of Automated Customer Service?

If you are interested in working on some of the most challenging technical and programmatic issues, we would love to discuss with you the exciting work and career opportunities at Netomi.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Netomi, you will drive NLP and machine learning projects and be responsible for developing methodology and solutions to support technical, analytical, and operational requirements.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and deploy machine learning models and algorithms for NLP/LLMs or deep learning models at scale to solve complex business problems.
Work with large datasets, perform data analysis, and develop data pipelines to support model development.
Collaborate with Product & Engineering teams to integrate machine learning solutions into products and services.
Conduct experiments, test hypotheses, and perform statistical analysis to validate models and drive improvements.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in machine learning, NLP/LLMs, deep learning, and related technologies.
Provide technical mentorship and guidance to junior team members.
Requirements
3+ years of experience as a data scientist, preferably in a product development environment, with a focus on building NLP/LLMs or Deep Learning models.
Strong programming skills in Python or other relevant programming languages.
Experience with machine learning libraries (e.g., sci-kit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Deep understanding of statistical analysis, probability theory, and experimental design.
Experience with LLMs, deep learning, NLP, and chatbot development.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with a variety of statistical models, including logistic regression, clustering, classification, SVMs, neural networks, Random Forest, CRF, Bayesian models, supervised/unsupervised learning, etc.
Expertise in NLP techniques, including sentiment analysis, word embedding, part-of-speech (POS) tagging, topic modeling, text classification, machine translation, speech recognition, named entity recognition (NER), natural language generation (NLG), and other related techniques.
Experience with various deep learning techniques, including CNNs and RNNs, and a strong understanding of building and training these models for different applications. Familiarity with LMs and LLMs such as GPT, BERT, and Transformer models is highly desirable.
Strong ability to rapidly comprehend and implement research papers related to AI, as well as remain informed of the latest advancements in NLP technologies.
Deep knowledge and experience in structured and unstructured data Information Extraction, Knowledge Information Retrieval, and Knowledge Representation.
Self-motivated and driven to satisfy intellectual curiosity through the pursuit of continuous learning and skill development.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Optional: Experience with large-scale data processing technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and distributed computing systems.
Netomi is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Senior Data Scientist - Search & Recommendation
job_summary: Faire will soon be known as a top destination for data scientists and machine learning, and you will help take us there! How can we improve purchase flow?
job_description:
About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local — independent retailers around the globe are doing more revenue than Walmart and Amazon combined. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.

By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We're looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

About this role

Faire is using machine learning to change wholesale and help local retailers compete with Amazon and big box stores. Our experienced data scientists and machine learning engineers are developing solutions related to discovery, ranking, search, recommendations, logistics, underwriting, and more - all with the goal of helping local retail thrive.

The Data Science team owns a wide variety of algorithms and models that power the marketplace. We care about building machine learning models that help our customers thrive.

As a member of Search for the Data Science team you'll be responsible for developing machine learning-powered search ranking models and adding personalization to our search and discovery. You'll determine answers to questions like, how relevant is this product to this retailer and how can we infer that in real-time? Can we create real-time embeddings of users' interests and use them to power rankings? How can we improve purchase flow? What techniques can we use to enable our A/B tests to more quickly converge when dealing with low sample sizes?

Our team already includes experienced Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers from Uber, Airbnb, Square, Facebook, and Pinterest. Faire will soon be known as a top destination for data scientists and machine learning, and you will help take us there!

You're excited about this role because…

You'll be able to work on cutting-edge search query and understanding problems combining a wide variety of data about our retailers, brands and products
You want to use machine learning to help local retailers and independent brands succeed
You want to be a foundational team member of a fast growing company
You like to solve challenging problems related to a two-sided marketplace

Qualifications

3+ years of industry experience using machine learning to solve real-world problems
Experience with search/query processing for product development
Experience with traditional, semantic, and hybrid search frameworks (e.g. Elasticsearch,
Solr, FAISS)
Strong programming skills
An excitement and willingness to learn new tools and techniques
Experience with relational databases and SQL
The ability to contribute to team strategy and to lead model development without supervision
Strong communication skills and the ability to work with others in a closely collaborative team environment

Great to Haves:
Highly recommended: Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or related STEM fields
Ability to quickly implement state of the art algorithms from an academic paper
Previous experience on graph neural network and/or language models

Faire's flexible work model aims to meet the needs of our diverse employee community by making work more flexible, connected, and inclusive. Depending on the role and needs of the team, Faire employees have the flexibility to choose how they work–whether that's mainly in the office, remotely, or a mix of both.

Roles that list only a country in the location are eligible for fully remote work in that country or in- office work at a Faire office in that country, provided employees are located in the registered country/province/state. Roles with only a city location are eligible for in-office or hybrid office work in that city. Our talent team will work with candidates to determine what locations and roles are eligible for each option.

Why you'll love working at Faire

We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is an owner of the business and taking part in the founding process.
We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 350,000 small business owners.
We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.

Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We're backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Salt Lake City, Atlanta, Toronto, London, New York, LA, and Sao Paulo. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.

Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

Faire is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please fill out our Accommodation Request Form (https://bit.ly/faire-form)

job_summary: Faire will soon be known as a top destination for data scientists and machine learning, and you will help take us there! Why you'll love working at Faire.
job_description:
About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local — independent retailers around the globe are doing more revenue than Walmart and Amazon combined. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. Faire leverages the power of machine learning and data insights to revolutionize the wholesale industry, enabling local retailers to compete against giants like Amazon and big box stores. Our highly skilled team of data scientists and machine learning engineers specialize in developing algorithmic solutions for notification and recommender systems, advertising attribution, and LTV predictions. Our ultimate goal is to empower local retail businesses with the tools they need to succeed.

At Faire, the Data Science team is responsible for creating and maintaining a diverse range of algorithms and models that power our marketplace. We are dedicated to building machine learning models that help our customers thrive.

As a Data Scientist on the Retailer team, you will work on solving shipping cost problems by leveraging machine learning models, engineering and analysis skills. You will help drive the adoption of the Ship-with-Faire (SWF) program among brands and optimize the SWF program economics.

Our team already includes experienced Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers from Uber, Airbnb, Square, Facebook, and Pinterest. Faire will soon be known as a top destination for data scientists and machine learning, and you will help take us there!

Build ML models that provide accurate shipping cost estimates. Engineer new features to improve model performance. These models may use information from carriers (USPS/UPS/FedEx) and be both performant and explainable.
Maximize customer retention while keeping contribution profits in check.
Develop an in-house utility that can expose information about the shipping cost predictions, making model debugging more efficient for internal stakeholders.
Tackle complex issues inherent in managing a two-sided marketplace. Your ability to identify and address these challenges will be critical to our continued growth and success.

Qualifications

Strong machine learning skills and 3+ years of experience productionizing machine learning models (Sklearn, XGBoost, Predictive Modeling, or Deep Learning
Strong programming skills (Python, Java, Kotlin, C++)
Knowledge of statistical techniques such as experimentation and causal inference
SQL or other database querying experience preferred

title: Consultant, Advanced Analytics - 12 months
job_summary: Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. The role applies advanced concepts to utilize various advanced analytical techniques such…
job_description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you'll be doing

As a member of CIBC’s team, the Consultant, Business Analytics is responsible for supporting the delivery of advanced consulting advice in data analytics, providing research and insights, and ensuring senior management has the relevant information to make informed decisions. The role applies advanced concepts to utilize various advanced analytical techniques such as statistical modeling, data mining, and machine learning. The Consultant, Business Analytics provides insights that inform decisions influencing department strategy, performs in-depth analysis of research information to identify opportunities, develops proposals and makes recommendations for management’s use. The role works autonomously on day-to-day work, researching industry best practices, tools, and systems for reporting and data analysis, identifying and recommending enhancements to automated systems used to create a standardized reporting system. The role uses independent judgement to determine methods and approaches to work and acts as a resource integrator for their area.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How you'll succeed

Business Effectiveness - Identify and recommend changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.

Strategic Thinking Approach – Drive, manage and execute data and reporting projects and initiatives in alignment with CIBC Strategy while supporting the business goals, objectives and key performance indicators. Ability to think strategically about how to mobilize and engage teams across the enterprise to deliver strategic change.

Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between the Data and Reporting and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success. Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners.

Communication - Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.

Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.

Who you are

You can demonstrate experience with: programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).

You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).

You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.

You demonstrate knowledge in organization's Information Technology (IT) environment and understand the integration / interdependencies of various processes across a line of business.

You have stellar communication skills. You have the ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation. You also have the ability to express oneself and communicate with others verbally; recognizing that verbal communication is more than just language - it includes tone, style and structure.

You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.

You act like an owner. You understand business and process requirements in order to define fairly complex processes or a sub set of processes affecting a line of business

Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive compensation, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and moment makers, our social, points-based recognition program

Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to build innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients

We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like purpose day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development

What you need to know

title: Marketing Data Scientist
job_summary: You have a solid foundation using Python/Pyspark for data science, writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources, and…
job_description:
Who we are

Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 13 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada’s favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the funding of three major players. With over 60 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead

Who we need

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Marketing Data Science, we are looking for a Marketing Data Scientist who brings the technical expertise and practical knowledge to leverage analytics and demonstrate marketing effectiveness. You will play a pivotal role and take ownership of our post-campaign analytics, developing our omnichannel campaign deployment, and delivering data-driven recommendations for personalized member offers. From testing new campaigns, building dashboards, and presenting impact, you will work strategically and creatively to ensure we are engaging and delighting our members.

What's in it for you

Ownership. We are a data science driven company. Our customer database is one of Canada's largest and most complex, with data from dozens of different partners and millions of members. Every project you work on will have a sizeable impact on the organization as a whole and our loyalty program members.

Future forward impact. This is a chance to define and shape your role as part of a future-forward team that values authenticity and invites fresh perspectives. Joining us now is a chance to drive decisions and bridge post-campaign analytics with marketing plans. You will have the opportunity to recommend tools, approaches, and best practices as well as expand our data-driven marketing capabilities.

Anticipation. With over 30% of our team promoted within the last year, we have a proven history of supporting the growth of our people. You will work with a manager whose focus is to remove barriers and empower his team to collaborate seamlessly and accomplish great things. You will be supported in your day-to-day deliverables - growing your presentation skills, and contributing to decision-making - and in your overall career development. Whether you want to move into Machine Learning and data modelling or explore another area of our business or one of our parent companies, there is always something to look forward to.

As our new Marketing Data Scientist, you will:
Build. You will code and develop omnichannel campaigns for member engagement and offers. You will work with partners to define campaign objectives, target audiences, test requirements, and delivery timelines.
Analyze marketing data. You will monitor campaign performance and consult on adjustments to marketing strategy based on your findings. You will conduct post-campaign deep dives, collaborating with Marketing, Partnerships and Data Science to implement changes to messaging and ensure alignment on objectives.
Optimize. You will augment existing campaigns with insights and tools created by the data science team. You will identify gaps in data point collection, demonstrate areas for further exploration and targeting, and evolve the entire campaign process to improve efficiency and reduce errors. You will implement campaign testing to drive meaningful outcomes.
Grow. You will research new tools, trends, and approaches, and work with vendors to stay up to date with the latest methodologies and best practices in the field.

You bring:
The analytics. You have a background in data science and experience in marketing and campaign analytics. Ideally, you have worked on customer loyalty programs, identifying trends and opportunities to create effective, engaging campaigns. You have worked with big data sets in a customer-facing industry and you can apply your findings to drive decisions and pinpoint gaps in data point collection. You have experience with testing frameworks like A/B, long-term control holdouts and price optimization. You can distill data to key relevant findings, create and make presentations, tell a story and use data visualization to enhance your message.
The technical skills. You can learn new tools independently and quickly. You are proficient in MS Office, including the strengths in building presentation decks in PowerPoint that succinctly convey results and provide data-based recommendations. You have a solid foundation using Python/Pyspark for data science, writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources, and using Tableau for data visualization. You have strong digital business acumen and a proven record of successfully working with marketing automation tools like Salesforce, Hubspot, Adobe, Moengage, etc.
Interpersonal skills. You can nurture relationships across internal and external teams: gaining trust to influence decisions. You have professional communication skills, including translating complex analytics concepts and findings for different audiences and levels.

Why work for Scene+? The best of all worlds. We offer:
Perks. Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, performance-based bonuses, and extra rewards from our owners, including discounted rates on mortgages, banking, movies, and groceries.
Transparency. Our strategic focus comes from our owners, along with funding and infrastructure support. The creative approach and direction is Scene’s to run with.
Warmth. We’re nurturing an authentic culture of relationship building, knowledge sharing, and creativity. As we continue to grow and work together, everyone is invited to share ideas for fun with the team.
The future. We are all about living in the moment while looking towards the future. Because to us, the only thing more exciting than today is tomorrow.

Apply now.

If you have 70% of what we're looking for and 100% authenticity and passion, express your interest here. Please contact us by email and let us know what accommodations or assistance we can provide you during the application process.

At Scene+, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strive to integrate these values into everything we do, from our partners and offers to our teams and interactions. We welcome and appreciate candidates from diverse backgrounds, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous and People of Colour (BIPOC), the LGBTQ2SIA+ community, and other equity-seeking groups.

title: Senior Data Scientist (Reinforcement Learning)
