title: Senior Data Analyst
job_summary: You have in-depth experience building reports connecting data sources and creating visualizations that present the data most effectively.
job_description:
Who we are

Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 13 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada’s favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the funding of three major players. With over 60 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead

Who we need

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst who can take the data and tell a story from multiple perspectives. We are one of Canada's top loyalty programs with 10 million+ members. You will tap into our rich cross-industry data resources to bring proven value to our owners and partners and delight our members.

What's in it for you

Ownership. We are a data science-driven company, and our membership is growing exponentially. You will be part of a fun, driven, small but scaling team that operates like a startup. We are adaptable, collaborative, and fast-paced. You will have the opportunity to recommend and work with new tools and processes, share knowledge, and introduce best practices. Joining us at this stage is a chance to channel your passion for technology toward creating new capabilities and enabling the company to make intelligent decisions.

Future forward impact. You'll be part of a future-forward team that values authenticity and invites fresh perspectives. You will gain exposure to every major customer-driven industry - and access to vast volumes of diverse data. You will receive in-depth onboarding, access to insights into growing a national loyalty program, and the visibility you need to make an impact, including the opportunity to present your findings to our SVP or President regularly.

Anticipation. With giants in banking, grocery, and entertainment as our owners and partners across various categories like travel, shopping and dining, this is an opportunity to gain exposure across a wide range of sectors. With over 30% of our team promoted within the last year, we have a proven history of supporting the growth of our people. Whether you want to increase your influence with us directly or with a parent company, there is always something to look forward to.

As our new Senior Data Analyst, you will:
Share insights. You will extract insights from the data to learn more about our members. You will distill the technical language from these insights to translate your findings into accessible, engaging language, data visualizations, and other forms of presentation for our leadership and non-technical teams to understand and apply.
Code. You will use Python and SQL to gather, clean, organize, and analyze structured and nonstructured data. You will draw on your insights and experience to choose the most effective and impact charts, graphs, and diagrams to illustrate the results and recommendations of your data analysis.
Analyze. You will dive into the consumer data to generate owner-specific reports. You will explore anomalies, finding root causes or drawing attention to trends that can be capitalized.
Collaborate. You will work as part of the Business Intelligence and Data Engineering teams to automate processes, improve the data quality for our machine learning models and add more value to our loyalty product.

You bring:
The experience. You can tell a story with data and visual presentations. You have worked as a Data or Business Analyst at a fast-paced startup in a collaborative and autonomous role. Or, you may be coming from another industry and looking for a challenge to innovate and propose changes with less red tape and more responsiveness. You enjoy continuously exploring what can be learned and applied from data.
The technical skills. You know how to use the latest tools to work with terabytes of data - defining the query parameters, accessing large sets, conducting analyses, and gleaning insights. You are proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau and can quickly come up to speed with new technologies. You have in-depth experience building reports connecting data sources and creating visualizations that present the data most effectively.
Interpersonal skills. You can nurture relationships across internal and external teams. You have professional communication skills, including making presentations to senior leadership. You can translate complex data analytics and findings into visualizations and actionable insights for different audiences and levels.

Why work for Scene+? The best of all worlds. We offer:
Perks. Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, performance-based bonuses, and extra rewards from our owners, including discounted rates on mortgages, banking, movies, and groceries.
Transparency. Our strategic focus comes from our owners, along with funding and infrastructure support. The creative approach and direction is Scene’s to run with.
Warmth. We’re nurturing an authentic culture of relationship building, knowledge sharing, and creativity. As we continue to grow and work together, everyone is invited to share ideas for fun with the team.
The future. We are all about living in the moment while looking towards the future. Because to us, the only thing more exciting than today is tomorrow.

Apply now.

If you have 70% of what we're looking for and 100% authenticity and passion, express your interest here. Please contact us by email and let us know what accommodations or assistance we can provide you during the application process.

At Scene+, we're committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We strive to integrate these values into everything we do, from our partners and offers to our teams and interactions. We welcome and appreciate candidates from diverse backgrounds, including women, persons with disabilities, Black, Indigenous and People of Colour (BIPOC), the LGBTQ2SIA+ community, and other equity-seeking groups.

#LI-Hybrid

title: Senior and Intermediate Machine Learning Engineer
job_summary: Thrive on data-driven development, always looking for ways to analyze and improve with data. In the past year, our engineering and data science team grew from …
job_description:
EvenUp is a venture-backed generative AI startup that ensures injury victims are awarded the full value of their claims, expanding the $100B+ in awards granted to injury victims every year. Every year, the legal system has made it difficult for millions of ordinary people to seek justice, especially for folks without means or who come from underrepresented backgrounds. Our vision is to help these injury victims get the justice they deserve, irrespective of their income, demographics, or the quality of their legal representation.

EvenUp operates across all types of injury cases, from police brutality and child abuse to California wildfires and motor vehicle accidents. Our ML-driven software empowers attorneys to accurately assess the value of these cases by doing a core part of their workflow (legal drafting), enabling them to secure larger settlements in record time. As EvenUp evaluates more cases, our proprietary data grows, enhancing the precision of our predictions and delivering more value to both attorneys and victims alike.

As one of the fastest growing startups ($0 to $10M in ARR in <2 years), we raised $65M in investment from some of the best investors in the world (Bessemer, Bain Capital, Signalfire, DCM, NFX, Tribe Capital), seasoned tech executives (i.e. founder of Quora, SVP at Google, former CPO at Uber), and public figures that care about our social mission (Nas, Jared Leto, Byron Jones). Our team comes from top tech, legal, and investing backgrounds including Waymo, Google, Amazon, Uber, Quora, Blizzard, Norton Rose, Warburg Pincus, Bain, and McKinsey.

Why we're hiring machine learning engineers:
In the past year, our engineering and data science team grew from <10 to ~30 and we rolled out infrastructure updates, new products, and updates to existing workflows - combining data, ML frontend and backend work. The next 12 months are very exciting for us; we expect the technical team to triple to 80+ as we deliver on a roadmap to handle 10x our current volume. Now is the time to get on the ground floor as we scale!

We are looking for machine learning engineers who are passionate about building production machine learning products with a world-class team headed up by Matyas (lead early and foundational teams at Quora and Uber). You will have immense opportunities to work on a broad range of business/technical problems and technologies, build machine learning models, and design/automate/deploy production machine learning pipelines. We share a passion for problem-solving, new technologies, and learning, so you will be highly encouraged to explore new technologies and develop innovative solutions that could take the team's machine-learning engineering capability to the next level.

What you'll do:
You will build and deploy machine learning models in production that tangibly impact the lives of our customers
You will be responsible for technical roadmaps and will collaborate with Product Management, Product Engineering, and Design to shape the overall product roadmap
You will be a strategic partner for leaders across the organization on driving business impact through machine learning
You will coach and mentor the next generation of strong engineers on the team

What we're seeking:
Experience building machine learning systems deployed to production
Industry or research experience in NLP, information retrieval, or entity resolution
Ability to communicate technical ideas or issues in easy-to-understand and actionable terms
Ability to translate theory and new ideas into practical shippable solutions

Nice to have:
Thrive on data-driven development, always looking for ways to analyze and improve with data
Can develop methods and algorithms from first principles where necessary as opposed to relying fully on packaged third-party solutions
Learn quickly and are seeking opportunities to work cross-functionally and with a diverse group of people
Are looking for new challenges to take your craft to the next level

Benefits & Perks:
We seek to empower all of our team members to fulfill our mission of making the world a more just place, regardless of our team’s function, geography, or experience level. To that end, we offer:

Fully remote setup - work from wherever you feel is best (Plus a stipend to upgrade your home office!)Flexible working hours to match your styleOffsites - get to meet your coworkers on a fully-expensed trip every 6-12 months!Choice of great medical, dental, and vision insurance plan optionsFlexible paid time offA variety of virtual team events such as game nights & happy hours
EvenUp is an equal-opportunity employer. We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_summary: You have a solid foundation using Python/Pyspark for data science, writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources, and…
job_description:
Who we are

Join Scene+ and be part of Canada's most robust lifestyle loyalty program with over 13 million members and growing! We are a trusted brand, driven by the belief that there's always something to look forward to with rewards for every kind of life. Our goal is to become Canada’s favourite loyalty program by nurturing our Members with rewards their way.

We're the exciting joint venture of Cineplex, Empire, and Scotiabank, blending the energy, optimism, and atmosphere of a startup with the funding of three major players. With over 60 team members and plans to grow more, we're an emerging, responsive company. We offer collaboration, accountability, challenges, and rewards to everyone who joins us.

Our motto is "Love what's next," and we believe it applies to your career too. Join us to help evolve the program, collaborate with amazing teams, and love what lies ahead.

Who we need:
Reporting to the Director, Data Science, we are looking for a Manager, Marketing Data Science. You will play a pivotal role in introducing and implementing best practices and processes in data-driven marketing, leveraging analytics to guide decisions, approaches, and delivery of omnichannel marketing campaigns. You will contribute to the optimization strategy, provide operational support, and guide the work of a Marketing Data Scientist, to ensure we are engaging and delighting our members at every opportunity.

What's in it for you:
Ownership. We are a data science driven company. Our customer database is one of Canada's largest and most complex, with data from dozens of different partners and millions of members. Every campaign you manage will have a sizeable impact on the organization as a whole and our loyalty program members.

Future forward impact. This is a chance to define and shape your role as part of a future-forward team that values authenticity and invites fresh perspectives. Joining us now is a chance to champion the marketing-data function, lead the initiative to bridge post-campaign analytics with marketing plans, and eventually build out and nurture a team. You will be relied upon to recommend tools, approaches, and best practices as well as expand our data-driven marketing capabilities.

Anticipation. With over 30% of our team promoted within the last year, we have a proven history of supporting the growth of our people. You will work with a manager whose focus is to remove barriers and empower his team to collaborate seamlessly and accomplish great things. Whether you want to move into Machine Learning and data modelling, or explore another area of our business or one of our parent companies, there is always something to look forward to.

As our new Marketing Data Scientist, you will:
Lead. You will oversee and contribute to the design, development, and deployment of omnichannel campaigns for member engagement and offers. You will build collaborative relationships with partners to define personalized campaign objectives for target audiences. You will implement campaign testing to drive meaningful outcomes and advanced processes to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of campaign analysis.
Optimize. You will act as a subject matter expert, advising adjustments to augment the performance of campaigns based on the data. You will review the results of post-campaign deep dives, and work closely with Marketing, Partnerships and Data Science to implement changes for future campaigns and ensure alignment on objectives. You will identify gaps in data point collection, demonstrate areas for further exploration and targeting, and evolve the entire campaign process to improve efficiency and reduce errors. You will research new tools, trends, and approaches, and work with vendors to stay up to date with the latest methodologies and best practices in the field.
Manage. You will coach and guide the work of a Marketing Data Scientist, sharing knowledge, removing barriers, and maintaining open communication.

You bring:
The analytics. You have a background in data science and experience in marketing and campaign analytics. Ideally, you have worked on customer loyalty programs, identifying trends and opportunities to create effective, engaging campaigns. You have worked with big data sets in a customer-facing industry and you can apply your findings to drive decisions and pinpoint gaps in data point collection. You have experience with testing frameworks like A/B, long-term control holdouts and price optimization. You can distill data to key relevant findings, create and make presentations, tell a story and use data visualization to enhance your message.
The technical skills. You can learn new tools independently and quickly. You are proficient in MS Office, including the strengths in building presentation decks in PowerPoint that succinctly convey results and provide data-based recommendations. You have a solid foundation using Python/Pyspark for data science, writing complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sources, and using Tableau for data visualization. You have strong digital business acumen and a proven record of successfully working with marketing automation tools like Salesforce, Hubspot, Adobe, Moengage, etc.
The project management skills. You can balance priorities, change direction based on shifting needs, and manage multiple projects simultaneously. You have expertise in creating plans from end-to-end, managing tasks, timelines, budgets, resources, and communications. You have a results-oriented mindset and can set performance goals and metrics to validate member engagement and marketing campaign effectiveness.
The leadership strength. You can nurture relationships across internal and external teams, gaining trust to influence decisions and holding your own to champion your ideas. You can manage and inspire a team, provide coaching, remove barriers, and ensure collaboration and alignment on common goals.

Why work for Scene+? The best of all worlds. We offer:
Perks. Enjoy a competitive salary and benefits package, performance-based bonuses, and extra rewards from our owners, including discounted rates on mortgages, banking, movies, and groceries.
Transparency. Our strategic focus comes from our owners, along with funding and infrastructure support. The creative approach and direction is Scene’s to run with.
Warmth. We’re nurturing an authentic culture of relationship building, knowledge sharing, and creativity. As we continue to grow and work together, everyone is invited to share ideas for fun with the team.

job_description:
Position Title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 22651

JOB PURPOSE: McCain is on a digital transformation journey and we are seeking a creative, courageous and data-driven individual to help shape and realize our vision for Finance. The primary purpose of this leadership role is to own how Finance Digital Technologies and Analytics will enable global business performance and profitable growth decision-making.

This role is responsible for driving how dynamic financial information, analysis and planning processes, can be improved using digital and data strategies/technology. This role will be the Finance lead shaping the analytics performance roadmap in Finance, partnering with technology, global and regional Finance teams. The role will set and own the global standard for transforming financial data into business performance information for decision-making.

In this role, the incumbent will serve as Finance Business partner to Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Agriculture functions to provide data analysis and insights, and recommend action plans to maximize the bottom line, leveraging diverse data sources.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify opportunities for descriptive and advanced analytics to drive profitability, provide financial understanding and direction to our business
Manage the development and sustainment of Profitability, Costing and Financial Planning models, analytical reporting, scorecards and dashboards
Set strategy and roadmap for how Digital Technologies, Financial Data and Analytics will be leveraged by Global and Regional Finance teams at McCain to enable rich financial information
Promote and drive the use of data and adoption of data analytics to Global and Regional teams to inform business decisions
Guide the continuous improvement of FP&A, Management Reporting and Profitability Analysis solutions in OneStream, SAP PaPM and SAP Analytics Cloud
Elevate and promote the use of SAP ERP, Management Reporting, Financial Planning Tools (OneStream, SAC, PaPM) and Analytics and their application with regional teams and key stakeholders, including c-level executives
Leverage diverse data sources to provide regular analytics insights, reporting and actionable recommendations to the FLT and other key stakeholders
Work in partnership with Finance, Technology and Data & Analytics teams locally and globally.

KEY PRIORITIES:
Drive continuous improvement strategy for finance to modernize how financial data information is used in a dynamic setting for business decision making
Simplify the current reporting processes to leverage more technology.
Identify opportunities to utilize existing and new data sources to identify relevant trends and propose actionable recommendations
Prioritize key reports and analysis that are essential to driving insight for profitable growth
Develop dashboards and reports that offer new insights and track metrics relevant to business performance
Work with Technology team to rapidly scale, modernize and automate reporting tools
extract from big data the meaningful trend, and propose actionable recommendations
Support user training and promote use of data and adoption of
Build a backlog of new reports and dashboards to accelerate manual reporting activities, or provide necessary data to key business decision makers

Implementation of Digital Technologies and Business Processes
Collaborate with Technology, Global and Regional Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, HR and external implementation partners to ensure a globally aligned and efficient continuous improvement of finance performance management needs
Liaise and translate the regional McCain team’s requirements and expectations

Business partnership
Strategic financial partner to Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture functions
Provide insights about opportunities to maximize revenue, minimize cost and increase operational efficiency to drive the bottom line
Accountable for identifying decisions worth making with data, framing them (including defining metrics and key assumptions), and proposing actionable recommendations

MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
Simplification of the reporting/budgeting processes by leveraging more technology
Implementation and adoption of best practice Finance processes and Digital Technology
Transformation of how we utilize data science and analysis at McCain Foods
Team Engagement (both at corporate level and regional level)

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Bachelor’s Degree, CPA (preferred)
5-7 years working with data to drive decision making and strategy; with a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in a large, global organization
Experience in translating data use cases, requirements to Data Science/IT teams and translating results into insights for the business
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Knowledge and expertise in SAP Finance modules and tools and how they integrate with Sales, Procurement, Manufacturing and Logistics processes
Strong awareness of data best practices and what’s possible with rich data
Excellent communication skills and ability to build compelling narratives with data
Experience with requirement analysis (interviewing, facilitation, gap analysis, data analysis, business process mapping, user interface design and mock-up)
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Experience implementing best practice Finance business processes and driving new, innovative internal concepts or products to completion
Effective project management skills
Minimum three years of experience working with Financial Planning, BI and data visualization tools (e.g., OneStream, SAC and Power BI strongly preferred)
Experience in food industry, CPG or manufacturing, ideally in the Finance function

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Collaboration, Champions Change, Drives Results

CANDIDATE PROFILE:
Strategic, results-focused individual who has a love of best practices and data and is someone who embraces change and continuous improvement. This individual has a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in data/digital.

Proven leadership abilities. This individual will be known for their experience in leading a team through transformation change. The candidate will have led a team of peers and/or external suppliers through a high-profile, business-building initiative, demonstrating a persistence and patience that is unwavering in the face of obstacles. Furthermore, the candidate will have demonstrated skills in the delivery of multiple projects concurrently, with the demonstrated ability to prioritize within a changing business environment.

Strategic change skills. The successful candidate will be a leader in bringing fresh ideas and curiosity to drive the use of digital technology and analytics in our business; leading change and innovation in this area. They will be an individual who values diversity of perspective. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize data from multiple sources and to provide actionable insights to the business based on the story the data tells. The successful candidate will demonstrate an entrepreneurial flair and a tendency to thrive in environments with broad flexibility and scope.

Strong collaboration, relationship-building and people development skills. The successful candidate is known for their ability to build strong partnerships with a variety of stakeholders – senior management peers, functional reports, suppliers and customers. They will be able to utilize their working relationships in order to garner new ideas and improve implementation. Must be able to roll up sleeves and get into details as needed.

OTHER INFORMATION

Key internal relationships: Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture, HR Leaders. Global and regional Finance teams. FLT engagement. Global Technology partners. Global and Regional Data and Analytics leads.
Travel: as required
Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment

Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com

title: Senior AI Specialist
job_summary: Experience with data collection, data audits, cleaning/imputing, and deriving aggregate measures and business metrics. Refactor and scale models for efficiency.
job_description:
Overview:
Senior AI Specialist

Adastra corporation is hiring! As Canada’s leading Data and AI company, we are looking for a Senior AI Specialist to work with a team of Adastra consultants in delivering high-impact Advanced Analytics and Data Science projects.

The Senior AI Specialist will employ cutting-edge methodologies and robust analytical techniques to generate insights and create innovative models that enable our clients to uncover untapped revenue streams, optimize operational efficiencies, and mitigate risks.

Location: Remote (with plans to return Onsite)

Status: Full-Time

Responsibilities:
Gather business requirements and identify opportunities for analytics and AI
Extract, validate, and consolidate data from disparate sources
Ensure compliance with data governance and architectural strategies
Explore and apply model development toolkits and machine learning approaches
Refactor and scale models for efficiency
Deploy data preparation and model pipelines to client environments
Present analytical results to technical and non-technical audiences using visualization tools
Adhere to development best practices

Qualifications, Skills & Experience:
Undergraduate in STEM; Master's/Ph.D. preferred
2+ years of experience solving practical business problems
Experience with data collection, data audits, cleaning/imputing, and deriving aggregate measures and business metrics
Advanced proficiency in Python with expertise in programming, data analysis, cleaning, visualization, modeling, statistical analysis, and deployment
Proficient in programming languages like Java or C++, including ability to write efficient and scalable code for building mathematical models and optimization algorithms
Experience with analytical tools and frameworks such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, Keras, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.
Familiarity with SQL and relational database management systems
Experience training and scaling models, including predictive and prescriptive analytics applications
Understanding of statistical principles and distributions
Experience deploying and managing applications in the cloud (AWS, Azure, and/or GCP)
Knowledge of software development practices, such as version control systems, DevOps, and collaborative toolsets
Familiarity with Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and tools, which can be used to analyze and understand natural language data
Familiarity with big data technologies, such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Project management skills include ability to manage deadlines, collaborate with team members, and prioritize tasks

Required Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills: ability to analyze and solve practical/complex business problems using AI, machine learning, mathematical modeling and optimization techniques
Ability to work collaboratively with other team members and clients to identify opportunities for analytics and AI
Strong communication skills are essential: ability to write and communicate clear and concise technical concepts, documentation, reports, and presentations to non-technical stakeholders
Critical thinking skills: ability to assess the feasibility and effectiveness of different models and methods, identify potential risks and limitations, and make data-driven decisions
Creative thinking skills: ability to develop innovative solutions to complex problems and to think outside the box when traditional methods do not work

About Adastra

At Adastra, we transform the Data & Analytics space by providing cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud, Digital and Governance services. Our consultants specialize in transforming enterprise applications and collaborate across functions, competencies, and sectors to help our clients harness and leverage their data assets, accelerate innovation, improve operational excellence, and create unforgettable customer experiences.

Adastra has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 20 consecutive years, reinforcing our position as a best-in-class organization known for strategic excellence, innovation, and culture. People are at the core of Adastra's capabilities, and the Adastra Group has 2,500 consultants actualizing projects across 16 global branches.

There has been an increased instance of fraudulent job offers coming from people posing as Adastra HR employees. Please note that Adastra will never request fees as part of our recruiting process and any emails sent to you that are not from ‘@adastragrp.com’ or ‘@talent.icims.com’ are fraudulent. All employment offers are sent via DocuSign and if you receive an employment offer from a suspicious email and not via DocuSign, it is fraudulent.

Contact careers@adastragrp.com to inquire about jobs at Adastra, to report a suspicious request for money or personal information from external websites or suspicious employment offers.

What We Offer

Opportunity for advancement and career progression
Competitive compensation package
Comprehensive benefits plan
Successful referral program
A flexible and dynamic workplace
The opportunity to work with one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies
Satisfaction of working for a reputable company

Equal Opportunity Employer

In our commitment to promote fair and equitable treatment of all employees and applicants, Adastra Corporation provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of age, sex, disability, race, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sexual orientation, marital status or any other ground as described in the Ontario Human Rights Code. In addition, accommodation will be provided during the hiring process. Adastra Corporation’s implementation and support of employment initiatives, encourage diversified labour force participation and equal access to opportunities based on merit and performance.

title: Director of Go-To-Market Analytics, Revenue Operations GTM Insights & Analytics
job_summary: Deep expertise in statistical analysis, data analytics, & modelling for actionable business insights from complex data sets.
job_description:
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 20 years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,100 networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

As a member of the Go-To-Market (GTM) Insights & Analytics (IA) leadership team, the role holder is responsible for ensuring the quality, integrity, & availability of data analysis & modelling related to EQIX’s go-to-market strategies. Reporting directly to the Senior Director (Global Head) of Revenue Operations (RevOps) GTM IA, you will lead & guide the GTM Analytics team’s robust analytical collaborations across RevOps & the Customer & Revenue Office, & leverage data-driven approaches to shape effective GTM strategies for sales, marketing, customer care, experience, success, & commercial operations, evaluating & providing actionable insights, driving consistent segmentation & targeting, and utilising predictive/prescriptive data science that empowers data-driven decisions driving predictable revenue acceleration through optimised customer experiences.

Responsibilities

Oversee & guide the full range of GTM Analytics & best practices

Oversee & guide RevOps GTM analytics, leading a team of analytics professionals & leveraging industry best practices & advanced statistical analytical techniques, predictive & prescriptive AI/ML & technologies to analyse complex datasets, derive actionable insights, & shape effective segmentation, targeting, optimised customer experiences & revenue-accelerating GTM strategies.

Develop & execute a comprehensive analytics strategy aligned with company objectives

Develop a comprehensive GTM analytical plan & roadmap by understanding company objectives, goals, & GTM priorities, identifying areas for analytics, engaging stakeholders, & defining measurable KPIs.

Evaluate data availability & quality, & identify suitable sources, systems, tools, & analytics techniques for reliable analysis, visualisation, forecasting, & decision-making.

Establish operational infrastructure/architecture with the DataOps team & build a skilled analytics team to execute data-driven approaches, plans & roadmap.

Establish & maintain strong analytical interlocks with relevant stakeholders

Collaborate & position the team as the analytical point of contact with cross-functional RevOps & the Customer & Revenue Office priority stakeholders to gather input, align objectives, facilitate the adoption of interoperable practices & ensure consistent delivery of analytical GTM value.

Effectively & regularly communicate insights, recommendations, analytical findings, outcomes & value generated from analytics initiatives (with scale) to internal stakeholders, leadership & external partners.

Continuously monitor the performance of GTM analytics initiatives & evaluate their effectiveness, soliciting feedback to refine & iterate the GTM analytics strategy as needed.

Provide actionable insights, & empower data-driven decisions

Leverage appropriate analytical techniques & tools to conduct thorough data analysis, extracting actionable insights that inform GTM decision-making by uncovering, visualising, & presenting trends, patterns, correlations, probabilities & forecasts in clear and compelling reports, dashboards, and data visualisations that enable stakeholders to make informed decisions to shape effective GTM strategies.

Lead & manage a diverse team of analytics professionals, fostering innovation & continuous improvement

Manage GTM Analytics teams' performance through motivation, engagement, & coaching.

Drive people development strategy, including location-based & hybrid-virtual initiatives.

Provide transformational leadership & guidance for escalations & interlocks to other stakeholders.

Establish GTM Analytics processes based on industry best practices for EQIX's best-in-class approach.

Model Equinix cultures & values.

Provide guidance, mentorship, & development opportunities to enhance teams' skills & capabilities.

Qualifications

Substantial experience overseeing data analytics, modelling, insights generation, team leadership, & shaping data-driven GTM strategies.

Deep expertise in statistical analysis, data analytics, & modelling for actionable business insights from complex data sets.

Proven track record in leading & managing high-performing teams, fostering collaboration, & providing mentorship & professional development.

Familiarity with advanced analytics, predictive & prescriptive AI/ML & technologies to optimise GTM strategies & customer experiences.

Effective stakeholder management & communication skills to engage cross-functional teams, senior leadership, & external partners.

Knowledge of RevOps &/or Customer & Revenue Office, including GTM segmentation, sales, marketing, customer care/success & commercial ops.

Committed to continuous improvement by staying updated with industry trends, emerging technologies, best practices in analytics, & embracing open-source transformation.

Preferred: Bachelor's degree in a related field (Data Analytics, Data Science, Business Analytics/Administration, Economics/Econometrics, Computer Science, IT, or similar). Optional: Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) or Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) certification.

Experience with Excel, SAS, SPSS, Python, R, ANOVA, MATLAB, Tableau, ESRI, Power Bi, Salesforce, Clari, AI/ML tooling & scripting.

Skills and Attributes

Enthusiastic collaborator, skilled in developing GTM analytics capabilities & rigour.

Prioritises strategic requirements & impacts in alignment with stakeholders.

Strong technical skills & a passion for optimising & automating.

Exceptional communication skills, specialising in data-driven storytelling & visualisation with a focus on predictive & prescriptive analytics.

Transformational leader driving bold & scalable change in GTM analytics.

Global mindset, excelling in matrixed & consensus-driven environments.

Cultivates innovation, embraces risk-taking, & learns from failure as a growth opportunity in GTM analytics.

Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision (Remote)
job_summary: Experience with distributed and cloud-based data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam. Investigate what technologies that will best enable…
job_description:
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer - Computer Vision to join our growing ML team. You will work on challenging computer vision problems to have an impact on the 31,000+ life scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, ML, you'll apply your domain expertise to select, train and deploy the best-suited machine learning algorithms, collaborate and experiment with scientists, and apply techniques to build solutions to shape the future of scientific discovery. You will have plenty of room for technical innovation and greenfield to explore and propose computer vision solutions to a complex area.

You will:
Improve the performance and scalability of ML models and pipelines that are at the core of BenchSci's products
Work on different stages of the problem from prototyping to production
Contribute to key components across the machine learning ecosystem defining BenchSci's ML Technical Roadmap
Investigate what technologies that will best enable BenchSci to identify experimental insights through proof-of-concepts
Work with diverse teams to correctly capture the nuances of biology, translating them into ML objectives
Advocate for code and engineering process improvements across your team, and help define best practices
Participate in sprint planning, estimations, and reviews
Work with teammates to ensure high-quality deliverables

You have:
3+ years of experience working as a professional developer, with at least 2 years of this focused on machine learning and computer vision
A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other related disciplines
Excellent software engineering skills in Python
Comprehensive knowledge in the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, including the nuances of the infrastructure and operationsExperience with ML and/or Computer Vision fundamentals
Experience productionizing ML models Experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, and image processing libraries such as OpenCV and Scikit-image
Experience with distributed and cloud-based data processing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Apache Beam
A constant desire to develop
A team player who strives to see teammates succeed together

Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.
About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

job_description:
CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Job Description

POSITION PURPOSE
Cloud Engineers set up, operate, develop, evolve, and maintain cloud-centric platform(s) including IoT, Customer Solution Delivery, Data Science Environments and Software Delivery, as well as satellite tools and environments (file storage, databases, tensorflow, data streaming, eventing, machine learning and big data frameworks, notebook technologies, and container orchestration tooling).

SCOPE
Global
MAJOR / KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Responsible for experimenting with and implementing machine learning frameworks for data science/machine learning development and operationsResponsible for learning and operating new data science frameworks and technologies and exploring their viability for current and planned projectsResponsible for learning and operating data storage frameworks and technologies and exploring their viability for current and planned projectsResponsible for learning and operating data recovery, data backup and high availabilityResponsible for learning, operating, evolving, contributing to, and maintaining Digital bespoke frameworks that support the BRIX platform (such as specific data pipes)Responsible for rigorous testing of framework robustness and scalabilityWill contribute to data science teams across Digital and the engineering teams discussions, providing insight as needed on other team member’s current approaches and methods as well as on tools and data repositories.Liaise with Cloud Team (Global IT) to understand company-wide cloud standards and policies and ensure complianceSupporting Serialization and Asset digitization programs across Company by setting up and maintaining IoT and Edge platformsResponsible for the Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines to support product and software deliveryResponsible for contributing to capability building of the Cloud Engineering team, including researching and staying up-to-date on best practices e.g. GitOps, IaC (infrastructure as code).

Successful roll out, development and continuous evolution and operation of cloud-based data science and machine learning platforms, IoT, Edge and Software Delivery frameworks, both for research & development and for continuous operationEffective support of data science projects, digitization projects and software delivery projectsReliability of systemsAdoption of systems
AUTHORITY / DECISION MAKING
Data science and machine learning frameworks, IoT, Edge and Software Delivery frameworks, selection and implementationTooling selection and implementationWorking autonomously in a highly matrixed organization
KEY CONTACTS
Global IT, Digital Data Science and Application Development team, Digital Product Teams (PM), Software Engineering Team
External:
Potential vendors (i.e., security)
QUALIFICATIONS
BS degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics, Physics, or similar formal training or equivalentProven experience with looking after data recovery and database high availability and database tuningProven experience with FinOps and being able to optimize spend for CE impactExperience with working with IoT and Edge interaction with the Cloud
EXPERIENCE
5 years relevant experience in Cloud / DevOps Engineering or adjacent fieldsInstalled, operated, and managed several data science and machine learning frameworks, or developed own data science methodologiesExperience with Continuous Integration and Continuous DeploymentExperience operating, optimizing, querying, and administering databases (such as Postgres, TimescaleDB, etc.)Comfortable using and working in a polyglot computer language environment (Python, Go, Julia etc.)Experience with Amazon Web Services (S3, EKS, ECR, EMR, etc.)Experience with containers and orchestration (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes)Experience with Big Data processing technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Flink, etc.)Experience with interactive notebooks (e.g. JupyterHub, Databricks)Experience with Git Ops style automationExperience with *ix (e.g, Linux, BSD, etc.) tooling and scriptingParticipated in projects that are based on data science methodologies, and/or physical experiments, or statistical analysis – especially in a data engineer and dev ops capacity.
SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE
Knowledge of major data science and dev ops frameworks and methodsVery strong analytical skills and systems thinkingStrong programming skills in addition to operational skills a plus (ideally in one or more of the following languages: Python, Go, Julia, or C/C++)Attention to big picture and details
Preferred Education

Bachelors

Preferred Level of Work Experience

5 - 7 years

Owl.co enables insurers to fight illegitimate claims at scale while removing human bias from the process. Our clients are the top insurance companies across North America and are getting incredible results through our AI-powered evidence-based platform. We are on a mission to bring state-of-the-art ML and NLP methods to transform this traditionally manual activity into an equitable process. We are well-funded and have engineering offices in New York City, Toronto, and Vancouver.

About the Role:
We are looking for an ambitious and motivated Machine Learning Engineer to build the core intelligence behind products. You will be working across different functions – leading the design, implementation, and production of some of the most impactful systems in the insurance industry.

Develop clear, well-documented, and maintainable code across the entire stack
Mentor junior engineers and contribute to growth of the engineering team
Analyze user behavior from our platform to discover new features, trends, and insights aimed at improving our products
Contribute to the development and direction of our analytics practices

2+ years of ML experience with a strong track record of applied project work in the industry
Advance Degree or equivalent
Extensive experience with Python

RRSP matching up to 4% of base salary
4 weeks of vacation, 10 public holidays, plus 5 personal days

Dog-friendly office
Weekly team lunches in the office

title: Lead Data Scientist

optimized code and using state-of-the art machine learning technologies.

Build and manage support models incorporated into digital or AI products; Work with Infrastructure and Ops teams to ensure appropriate architecture and tooling
Capacity to mentor junior personnel
Be able to apply in-depth experience with both statistical and modern data
science approaches to business cases and knowledge management tasks
Strong written and verbal communication skills - ability to communicate complex ideas up to people of varying technical skills
Work with developers, engineers, and MLOps to deliver AI/ML solutions for new products/services

title: Product Manager - Computer Vision
job_summary: Discover and translate data into tractable data science questions and engineering specifications to guide strategic decision making.
job_description:
Events in recent years have made us all too familiar with the havoc that natural disasters can wreak, and the increasing frequency and intensity with which they are occurring. Despite record levels of losses, conventional methods of catastrophe risk modeling continue to paint at best, an incomplete picture of these threats.

Zesty.ai uses novel data gathering and machine learning approaches to produce higher quality information about the risks to property, from catastrophes like floods and wildfires. While AI alone may not be able to thwart these disasters, it can help communities around the world become more prepared for them, and ultimately that will lead to better outcomes for business and society.

As a Product Manager - Computer Vision, you are an analytical thinker and passionate about working with complex data. You are a pacesetter who wants to set the standard; you are organized, self-directed, committed to innovation and possess outstanding, empathetic and communication skills with clients and users. You will be crucial in operating the ZestyAI AI platform, delivering property characteristics and climate risk information to our clients, our publication, and our marketing efforts. You thrive in a collaborative and creative environment that moves fast and are comfortable learning new skills and working with unfamiliar technologies.

The Opportunity:
Own the product development lifecycle from conception to launch in the field of machine learning, risk and climate model, and computer vision
Build the analytics and model development roadmap of climate and risk solutions by researching and analyzing various sources of information
Discover and translate data into tractable data science questions and engineering specifications to guide strategic decision making
Work closely with Data scientists and Software Engineers as a key member of the product development team
Act as the model owner and special matter expert when interfacing with Regulators and Customers
Iterate rapidly on everything; all of the above happens in a fast-paced business-driven environment that you must be comfortable with
Work with our customers to understand complex workflows and pain points and find solutions to the problems

What You Bring to the ZestyAI Team:
4-7 years of work experience in analytics, data science, financial modeling, computer vision, climate modeling or other relevant field
Including 1-2 years of Product Management experience, working with data products or model-based features such as actuarial risk model, climate risk model, credit risk model, search model, etc.
Bachelor's or Master's in a quantitative field such as Engineering, Sciences, Commerce,
Outstanding communication skills, well-versed in building executive-style presentations
Ability to manage multiple/competing priorities and deliver on time Economics or Statistics
Proficient in SQL, Excel, Python
Excitement to be a part of insurTech and property tech industries
Must be legally eligible to work in Canada

Nice to Have:
GIS software (arcGIS, QGIS, PostGIS, BigQuery)
Exposure to insurance, real estate and risk modeling

Why ZestyAI:
Be a part of a well-funded growth-stage start-up
Work with a high-performance leadership team brought by top-tier risk analytics background
Market competitive comp and equity incentives to give you a stake in our future
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision care plans
Remote-first policy
Flexible Time Off
Home office setup stipend
Annual Learning and Development allowance
An upbeat and collaborative work culture
Company-sponsored outings and offsites

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

title: VP, Finance Systems and Data
job_summary: Expert in the technical aspects of analytics, data science and statistical methodologies, data management, analytical and data visualization software tools.
job_description:
The Vice President, Finance Systems and Data will lead the overall finance systems and data strategy and delivery execution to support the finance and accounting organizations. The VP, Finance Systems and Data will have a deep understanding of finance systems and associated processes and work closely with Finance business stakeholders and technology teams to solve complex business problems through a combination of optimized processes, systems, data and tools.

The VP, Finance Systems and Data will work closely with the Finance Leadership Team to identify and execute upon efficiencies and savings opportunities across our finance organization including within TR’s planning, forecasting, management reporting and business analysis activities. The role will lead the teams responsible for Global Reporting Systems, Planning & Forecasting Solutions, SAP, Financial Consolidation Systems and other bespoke systems.

The role will also develop and nurture key relationships across:

The Finance Leadership Team

The following functions within the Thomson Reuters Operations & Technology group:

Finance Automation & Analytics Centre of Excellence

Data & Analytics function

Corporate Services function

About the Role

In this opportunity as VP, Finance Systems and Data, you will:

Act as the thought leader for finance in coordinating the execution of major technology transformation and deployment, staying up to date with leading finance technology trends

Partner with finance process owners and application owners to develop and articulate detailed business requirements for key financial applications, including financial data and self-service financial reporting capabilities for non-finance customers

Partner with key finance stakeholders to support change projects and transformation in finance to lead and enable simplification and standardization across the Enterprise and key finance processes

Partner with key finance stakeholders and technology teams to consult with vendors to prioritize and document business needs and make recommendations for management

Baseline the current finance technology footprint and related data readiness – our “as is” state

Create and own the core Finance technology strategy, roadmap and business architecture, working as required with central technology teams and other stakeholders – our “to be” state

Partner with finance process owners and technology develop and implement innovative technology enabled solutions to address business requirements to get us from our “as is” to our “to be” state

Work closely with internal technology teams and third-party vendors to ensure successful development and delivery of software solutions and ensure meet business expectations including key activities such as, but not limited to: architecture/technical design & implementation, data integration/migration, issue resolution, integration testing, technical documentation, security standards implementation

Ensure that adequate controls are in place across our system and related infrastructure

Contribute to functional and managerial policies

Leadership and management of the central finance analytics and reporting teams

About You:
You will have demonstrated success in leading world-class Tech/Financial Systems teams. You will possess a broad business view and the ability to think through market dynamics, internal customer needs, and the overall business strategy. You will be a proven change-agent and will demonstrate a track record of success around leveraging leading-edge technology solutions and partnering effectively with stakeholders to innovate and drive business outcomes. You’re a fit for the role of VP, Finance Systems and Data if your background includes:

Bachelors degree in data science, finance, accounting, business or economics (Masters Degree preferred) or equivalent

15+ of related experience, including familiarity with Financial System Tools and Data Science, data inter-dependencies across numerous core systems and be extremely proficient in Digital and Automation opportunities and tools.

5+ years of experience managing analysts, data scientists and people managers/leaders including building new teams

Expert in the technical aspects of analytics, data science and statistical methodologies, data management, analytical and data visualization software tools

Experience in BI analytics and visualization tools: Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx, Microsoft Power Suite

Experience in SQL, Data Warehouse/Data Lake and data modelling

Extensive understanding of financial concepts including financial statement analysis, accounting, budgeting, profitability analysis, and standard costing methodologies

SAP S4 Hana and OneStream experience desired.

Demonstrated success navigating complex organizations and ability to be persuasive with a wide range of diverse audiences

Strong leadership qualities including effective executive presence / verbal and written communication skills

Demonstrated experience in being an agent for change; Influencing all areas of the organization

What’s in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

Hybrid Work Model: Currently the majority of our employees are working within a hybrid environment consisting of in-office and remote work, and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking
Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

#LI-JK3

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: UI Full Stack Developer, VP - Natural Language Processing (Toronto)
job_summary: You will collaborate with other NLP engineers, data scientists and business leaders to understand challenges facing the firm and its clients.
job_description:
How will you fulfill your potential?

A true greenfield opportunity, you will join the team as we embark on creating new, scalable and resilient Generative AI platform leveraging large language models for a complex finance industry. You will collaborate with other NLP engineers, data scientists and business leaders to understand challenges facing the firm and its clients. Your design and development work will contribute to a world-class client experience and optimize business performance.

Your Impact

You will be joining the team that builds and operates foundational Generative AI platform, used by the rest of Goldman Sachs to apply Conversation AI and Document AI based digitization, automation, productivity improvement and efficiency gains to the daily operations of the firm. We take the best components from open source and major cloud providers and adapt and expand them to accommodate unique needs of the firm.

Our Impact

At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning and natural language modeling alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering is at the critical center of our businesses. Our dynamic environment requires strategic thinking that is innovative and produces smart solutions.

The Goldman Sachs NLP and AI Platform team provides high-impact solutions for our engineers and business users responsible for solving problems of significant business value across multiple divisions of the firm. We build scalable and resilient systems using predictive modeling, natural language processing, deep learning, and other techniques on high-volume and high-velocity data. As a UI Full Stack Developer on the NLP and AI Platform team, you will be responsible for helping to build conversational AI services using Large Language Models that can enable interactions such as question and answering, summarization, and more.

Responsibilities may include:
Developing and implementing techniques for improving search and retrieval algorithm using language models.
Experiment & select appropriate AI models for a use case as well as building and training working versions of the models using AI platform.
Create reusable patterns, libraries and datasets.
Optimize, Fine tune and implement deep learning models on information extraction tasks like NER, Summarization and Question Answering.
Conducting research to identify new NLP techniques and approaches,
Evaluating the performance of NLP models and refining them to improve accuracy and efficiency.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate NLP solutions into existing applications and systems.
Build conversational AI services using Large Language Models that can enable interactions such as question and answering, summarization.
Build and enhance orchestration tools to enable semantic search data ingestion pipelines that will be used in document ingestion, vector embedding for document digitization, search and retrieval and conversational services.

Qualifications and desired skillsets include:
A degree in computer science, computational linguistics, or a related field.
Strong programming skills, particularly in Python and/or Java.
Strong UI and full stack development experience.
Experience in building Conversational AI services and orchestration using tools such as LangChain, Vector DB, LLMs, Inference tools such as AWS Sagemaker and experience in Prompt Engineering.
Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools as such Flyte, Airflow, Metaflow, experience with Big Data tools such as PySpark, Kafka.
Experience in building platforms using document extraction using Apache Nutch, JSoup etc.
Experience in designing and implenting large information retrieval systems using embeddings (ex: MiniLM), vector stores like (Faiss, PineCone, Vespa), similarity match & ranking techniques.
Working experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Knowledge of natural language understanding, question answering, summarization, sentiment analysis, and other NLP tasks.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, as well as the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.

Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Machine Learning Validation Engineer 2
job_summary: You will contribute to the core team that validate the tests for AMD GPU based compute software stack. You will be responsible for maintaining the ROCm stack…
job_description:
Overview:
WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. This is who we are at our best. One Company. One Team.

AMD together we advance_

Responsibilities:
THE ROLE:
We are looking for a dynamic, energetic Software Systems Design Engineer to join our growing team. You will contribute to the core team that validate the tests for AMD GPU based compute software stack. You will be responsible for maintaining the ROCm stack quality by running those test suites (automated, manual) and suggest enhancements that ensure enterprise quality for AMD’s Software Compute stack. You will work closely with other software and hardware engineers and architects This is an exciting opportunity to work on the cutting edge of GPU Compute technologies. Candidates with a solid foundation in computer science, research or project experience in GPU rendering, Machine Learning and performance are very welcome.

THE PERSON:
As a Jr. Software Systems Design Engineer, you will deliver our next generation of products in the computer graphics industry – 3D Gaming, Display Technologies, Compute, Virtual Reality, etc. In this high visibility position, your systems engineering expertise will be necessary to define products, develop solutions, assess root causes, and produce solution resolutions. As a senior member of the team, taking initiative in mentoring to achieve the team’s goal of on time delivery is expected.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Drive technical innovation to improve AMD’s capabilities across product development and validation, including software tools and script development, technical and procedural methodology enhancement, and various internal and cross-functional initiatives.
Responsible for AMD’s new GPU/System bring up, ROCm SW stack testing, etc.
Responsible for quality and performance timeliness of result for a portion of project/process.
Contribute to Improve overall process, quality of products.
Be involved in the automation of manual test cases and work closely with automation infrastructure.
Executing white box, black box, and regression tests for existing ROCm features.
Responsible for quality and timeliness of result for a portion of project/process.
Make more complex technical decisions independently.
Implement checks and balances independently to minimize the impact of mistakes.
Lead collaborative approaches with multiple teams.
Mentor others to achieve integrated projects.

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Good understanding of test lifecycle, QA process & terminology.
Strong knowledge of Device drivers, graphics, multimedia, Codec.
Test Execution Experience in an automation lab with multiple systems.
Define, develop, execute functional/performance/load tests, and integrate them with automated test systems.
Establishing and sharing best practices, designing, and executing a robust test strategy.
Proficiency in at least one programming language preferably Python.
Strong understanding & Hands-on exp. with Linux OS internals, device manager.
Hands-on issue debugging skills, issue isolation with Linux kernel, driver module level.
Strong understanding of PC hardware, SoC, Chipsets, Graphics cards, BIOS & VBIOS.
Understanding of parallel programming, ideally OpenCL, ROCm, CUDA, and OpenACC is a plus.
