title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations
job_summary: Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data.
job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.

Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights. Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams.
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen
Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Personal Competencies:
Delivers results. Works tenaciously toward and derives satisfaction from achieving challenging goals; pitches in where required without regard to status. Self-disciplined; measures progress and evaluates results; prevents irrelevant issues or distractions from interfering with the timely completion of important initiatives.
Interpersonal skills. Demonstrates clear, professional, and respectful communication in all interactions, consistent with an inclusive work environment. Treats others with dignity and respect. The team isn't just better for having you; the others are better by having you
Pursues excellence. Dedicates required time and energy to assignments or tasks to ensure that no aspect of the work is neglected; works to overcome obstacles to completing tasks or assignments. Raises the bar, and helps others reach it too.
Applied learning. Readily absorbs and comprehends new information from formal and informal learning experiences.
Embraces change. Actively tries to understand changes in work tasks, situations, and environment as well as the logic or basis for change; actively seeks information about new work situations.
Teamwork and collaboration. Adheres to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfils team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.

title: Senior Manager, Analytics – Stores & Services
job_summary: This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven…
job_description:
: 1258494

Who we are
As the Working and Learning Company, we at Staples Canada, are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable, and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn, and grow together.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team

Staples Canada is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
This role will drive analytical leadership within the company and enable data-based decision making to help Staples Canada become a leading data-driven organization. The individual will lead the Reporting & Insights practice for Stores & Services as part of the Enterprise Analytics & Data Science team. Our multi-tenant cloud platforms power our analytics and ML/AI capabilities and we’re looking for an active hands-on contributor to play a central role in helping our teams understand performance and impact of their strategies. Additionally, the role will be continuously challenged to bring forward valuable insights to help their partners make better and more informed decisions.

We’re on a transformation journey and this role will be a key enabler in accelerating our analytics practice. In addition to having direct ownership over Stores & Services, this role will work closely with various cross-functional partners and have the opportunity to build deep insights across the customer journey – extending to marketing, supply chain, and our B2B functions.

This position represents an ideal role for a highly motivated and highly analytical individual. We are a highly collaborative, agile work environment, so the ideal candidate would demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills and excellent technical depth. The successful candidate will be passionate about data and have a strong foundation in analytics, understanding business needs, and storytelling.

Specifically, You Will:
Strategy & Enablement:
Establish the company as the leader in leveraging and executing on a customer first data-driven strategyOwn and develop the vision, strategy, and execution for a best-in-class customer intelligence and analytics function, ensuring scalability of systems, governance, tools, capabilities, processes, and talentWork with other functions within Analytics and Engineering to curate and source together transactional/behavioural/operational data (in-store, online, third-party) into views that can easily be leveraged and trusted for decision making, connecting back to our customer, their journeys and business prioritiesDevelop suite of reporting tools, with a self-serve enablement focus, that define business impact and project success, while also providing deep insights on integrated data sets to evaluate short term and long-term ROIDrive both strategic and tactical execution to unlock the value of data across internal and external data sets and generate critical actionable insights to drive the decision-making processEstablish analytical standards and best practices to be leveraged across the company’s ecosystem

title: Risk Analytics Manager
job_summary: Deeply understand current and future data needs and communicate and prioritize them with data infrastructure teams. Data Process-Flow and Systems Integration.
job_description:
Do you have a spidey sense when it comes to fraud?

Then Jobber might be the place for you! We're looking for a Risk Analytics Manager to be part of our Business Operations department.

Jobber exists to help people in small businesses be successful. We work with small home service businesses, like your local plumbers, painters, and landscapers, to transform the way service is delivered through technology. With Jobber they can quote, schedule, invoice, and collect payments from their customers, while providing an easy and professional customer experience. Running a small business today isn't like it used to be—the way we consume and deliver service is changing rapidly, technology is evolving, and customers expect more. That's why we put the power and flexibility in their hands to run their businesses how, where, and when they want!

Our culture of transparency, inclusivity, collaboration, and innovation has been recognized by Great Place to Work, Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and more. Jobber has also been named on the Globe and Mail's Canada's Top Growing Companies list, and Deloitte Canada's Technology Fast 50™, Enterprise Fast 15, and Technology Fast 500™ lists. With an Executive team that has over thirty years of industry experience of leading the way, we've come a long way from our first customer in 2011—but we've just scratched the surface of what we want to accomplish for our customers.

The role:
The Risk Analytics Manager will be an integral part of the Business Analytics team supporting Risk operations within the Fintech area of Jobber's business. This position will have a mix of strategic and operative responsibilities that multiply Jobber's ability to protect against credit losses while adding a data focused approach to risk decision making. Risk Mitigation is a very important area of Business Analytics service offering and as such, prior experience in thought leadership positions in the area of Risk Analytics is essential for success.

The area of support:
Fintech is one of the fastest-growing parts of Jobber, and a core strategic priority for us as a company. We're investing in this growing area because we believe embedding financial tools within our product deepens our ability to help small businesses be successful. Whether it's helping small businesses get paid, offering financing to their customers, or accessing capital to invest in growth – we believe small business owners should have seamless access to financial tools that allow them to thrive.

Our Risk operations - a key group within the broader Fintech area - is central to Jobber's success, focused on keeping both our Jobber Payments customers and Jobber safe.

The Risk Analytics Manager will be fully responsible for all analytical work performed in the area of Credit Risk, including:

Data Process-Flow and Systems Integration

Spearhead the integration of data, analytics-related processes, and ML-driven strategies & data flows within user-decisioning and case management systems (e.g. Unit 21 etc.)
Champion the streamlining, standardization, and automation of risk data management processes
Champion the initiatives designed to ensure completeness and accuracy of risk-related data

Development & Optimization of Loss Prevention Systems

Design, build and maintain analytics-driven Loss (chargebacks and/ or fraud) Prevention Systems, e.g. systems for Behavioral Anomaly Detection, operative monitoring for Early Warning Indicators, and other data-driven solutions that help proactively detect and effectively prevent possible credit and fraud losses
Optimize existing systems through ongoing analysis of behavioral data to uncover new patterns of fraud or other financial risk
Optimize performance across Acceptance, Monitoring, Chargeback and Recovery processes via regular review of the rules, parameters and thresholds

Strategic Thought Leadership & Decision-Making Support

Support strategic decisioning in the area of Fraud and Credit Risk Management through in-depth data-driven analysis and strategic consulting on the risk prevention strategies (e.g. trade-offs between risk reduction and customer experience impacts)
Proactively alert the stakeholders of the possible risks and opportunities for improvement to power corrective action on risk tools and technology platforms
Identify, design and implement the informational systems that would support monitoring and reporting on the state of credit risk in a timely and efficient manner - to both operational and financial stakeholders at different levels within the organization

Cross-Functional Leadership & Collaboration

Support the design of the ML / AI solutions by providing Data Science Team by providing guidance, subject matter expertise, and custom-analytics insights
Deeply understand current and future data needs and communicate and prioritize them with data infrastructure teams
Closely collaborate with the Business Intelligence team on the implementation of the Credit Risk BI solutions

To be successful, you should have:
5+ years of analytical experience in the area of credit risk, fraud detection or equivalent, preferably in the capacity, that combines functional and / or project leadership with full hands-on analytical execution via programming tools
Strong SQL skills and ability to efficiently manipulate complex database structures for analysis
Experience in integration of data & analytics within Risk Case Management Systems
Python/ R skills and Machine Learning experience are an asset
Experience with BI tools (Mode, Tableau, Power BI or equivalent) is an asset
An analytical mindset and strong statistical skills. Ability to review and find trends in transactions and usage for signs of fraud or abnormalities, and quantify trends in the data by applying statistical techniques
Clear communication skills. You'll be dealing with multiple stakeholders in the company on complex quantitative issues, so being able to translate and communicate your ideas and findings clearly will be important
The ability to embrace ambiguity. We don't know what we don't know, so you should be comfortable coming in and improving the process
The ability to work autonomously. We're currently working remotely, so while you'll be a member of a team and there are connection points, you'll be on your own for a majority of the day. You'll need to be a self-starter, with the ability to make decisions and find direction and guidance

What you can expect from Jobber:
Having been named as a Top 10 Great Place to Work in Canada, we walk the talk. Here are just some of the great things you can expect from us:

A total compensation package that includes an extended health benefits package with fully paid premiums for both body and mind, RRSP matching, and stock options.
A dedicated Coaching and Development function, including Development Coaches, to help build the career you want and hit the goals you set, while ensuring you're reaching your fullest potential.
Support for all your breaks: from vacation to rest and recharge, your birthday off to celebrate, health days to support your physical and mental health, and parental leave top-ups to support your growing family.
A unique opportunity to build, grow, and leave your impact on a $400-billion industry that has no dominant player...yet.
To work with a group of people who are humble, supportive, and give a sh*t about our customers.

We believe that diverse teams perform better and that fostering an inclusive work environment is a key part of growing a successful team. We welcome people of diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to working with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.

A bit more about us:
Job by job, we're transforming the way service is delivered. Your lawn care provider, home cleaning service, plumber or painter could use Jobber to better connect with their customers, save time in the office, invoice faster, and get paid! We're bringing tens of thousands of people together with technology to deliver billions of dollars a year in services to happy customers. Jobber exists to help make these small businesses successful, and when they're successful we all win!

title: Engineering Manager, Machine Learning - Natural Language Processing (Remote)
job_summary: Experience shipping machine learning into distributed, data-intensive production systems. Experience with data engineering and machine learning design patterns…
job_description:
We are looking for an Engineering Manager, Natural Language Processing to join our growing Machine Learning team and will report to the Director of Engineering, Machine Learning. You will lead a team that works on challenging problems to have an impact on the 41,000+ scientists across the world who rely on BenchSci for their research. As an Engineering Manager, NLP and Deep Learning, you will manage planning and prioritization of upcoming work, coordinate multiple engineering teams, and coach team members. You will work closely with tech leads and scientists to evaluate priorities, spot potential problems before they occur, and support the team's technical roadmap with planned engineering investments. Our ideal candidate is flexible, supportive and knows when to step in and work hands-on with their team and when to lean out and direct.

You will:
Execution: Own and drive execution of product and technical roadmaps. You will maintain and oversee the quality and output for everything your team provides
Management: Take a leadership role in our hiring and onboarding processes. You will mentor your team, guide their growth, and manage performance with fair, inclusive, and equitable practices
Technical: Work with technical leads and engineers to provide guidance on technical solutions, backup plans, trade-offs, and design. You will ensure your experienced team provides quality, ensuring they feel a culture of risk-taking, and can experiment to find the best solutions. You will work hands on when needed to support your team's delivery goals.
Processes: Work with Science, Web Apps, and Data Teams to define and improve processes across the company with growth in mind

You have:
4+ years working as a professional developer
2+ years working as an engineering team manager
Experience hiring and building motivated engineering teams
Strong experience with Python and programming fundamentals
Extensive experience working with NLP (including NER) and PyTorch
Experience with data engineering and machine learning design patterns and best practices
Experience shipping machine learning into distributed, data-intensive production systems
Strong experience collaborating cross-functionally
Worked on projects that have gone from proof-of-concept through multiple maintenance stages

Benefits and Perks:
An engaging remote-first culture
A great compensation package that includes BenchSci equity options
15 days vacation plus an additional day every year; plus company closures for 15 more days throughout the year
Unlimited flex time for sick days, personal days, religious holidays
Comprehensive health and dental benefits Emphasis on mental health with $2500 CAD* for Psychologist, Social Worker, or Psychotherapist services
A $2000 CAD* Annual Learning & Development budget
A $1000 CAD* home office set-up budget
A $2500 CAD*wellness, lifestyle and productivity spending account for employees
Generous parental leave benefits with a top-up plan or paid time off options
Benefits are tied to Canadian dollar amounts and would be converted to local currency for those in other countries. Moving to local currency allotments in the future.
About BenchSci:
BenchSci's mission is to exponentially increase the speed and quality of life-saving research and development. We empower scientists to run more successful experiments with the world's most advanced, biomedical artificial intelligence software platform.
Backed by Generation Investment Management, TCV, Inovia, F-Prime, Golden Ventures, and Google's AI fund, Gradient Ventures, we provide an indispensable tool for scientists that accelerates research at 16 top 20 pharmaceutical companies and over 4,300 leading academic centers. We're a certified Great Place to Work®, and top-ranked company on Glassdoor.

Our Culture:
BenchSci relentlessly builds on its strong foundation of culture. We put team members first, knowing that they're the organization's beating heart. We invest as much in our people as our products. Our culture fosters transparency, collaboration, and continuous learning.
We value each other's differences and always look for opportunities to embed equity into the fabric of our work. We foster diversity, autonomy, and personal growth, and provide resources to support motivated self-leaders in continuous improvement.
You will work with high-impact, highly skilled, and intelligent experts motivated to drive impact and fulfill a meaningful mission. We empower you to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and thrive. Here you will be challenged to stretch yourself to achieve the seemingly impossible. Learn more about our culture.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion: We're committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. We believe that improving diversity, equity and inclusion is our collective responsibility, and this belief guides our DEI journey. Learn more about our DEI initiatives.

Accessibility Accommodations: Should you require any accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs. Please reach out to talent@benchsci.com.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
job_summary: Explores existing data for insights and recommends additional sources of data for improvements. Experience with Data Science and supporting data scientists to…
job_description:
Our global Search & Analytics team is looking for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer. This position can be based near any of our US offices or Toronto.

About You...

Master's degree in Computer Science, Technology, or Engineering preferred.
Minimum 5 years relevant work experience (including internships).
Proven track record in the application of ML/NLP/Search Engine/Big Data.

What you will be doing in this role....

Identifies strategic information needs of internal clients and translates these into data requirements to build high performance data stores.
Design and implementation of ML model deployment infrastructure.
Works in collaboration with Data Scientists to constantly optimize the performance of the ML models.
Explores existing data for insights and recommends additional sources of data for improvements.
Track, verify, evolving data sources, data flows, tools & storage mechanisms

Technical & Professional Skills:
Big Data on cloud computing platforms with technologies such as Hadoop, Hive and Spark.
Excellent Python programming skills.
Experience with Data Science and supporting data scientists to get their models successfully deployed to production.
Machine learning knowledge: solid hands-on experience with: (1) multiple typical ML tasks such as classification/regression/clustering, (2) data gathering/data preprocessing/feature engineering, (3) model selection/testing/(re)training/monitoring.
Extensive knowledge of deployment tools such as AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Docker, Flask, MLFlow, and Airflow.

About our team:
Our scientists and engineers use Machine Learning, NLP, and Information Retrieval to solve problems along the entire Lifecycle of Innovation. From algorithms to classify content, to automating content extraction workflows, extracting and resolving entities, building recommender and decision support systems, predicting risk and outcomes, and enabling unique ways of finding content, these are just a few of the ways our team is fostering productivity of our customers who lead innovation in the world.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

title: Machine Learning Engineer, Fulfillment / Supply Chain
job_summary: Passion for applying data science to dynamic open-ended problems. Experience with big-data tools, e.g. Spark, Beam, Kafka. Experience in shell scripting/unix.
job_description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

As a Machine Learning Engineer on our team, you will be a key member of a team that has the goal of developing complete machine learning solutions that helps us build a better fulfillment platform that improves our customers’ experience as well as colleagues working in store operations. Leveraging the wealth of operational data available you’ll focus on delivering solutions that predict, forecast & optimize how we manage our inventory and our fulfillment capacity to provide a fulfillment experience that balances a complex trade-off between ensuring millions of Canadians who shop with us get their orders in a timely fashion and ensuring our operational & fulfillment costs stay low.

Your work requires communicating with an array of business stakeholders across Store Operations, Fulfillment Software Engineering Teams, Product Management, and Online Analytics to name a few primary ones. From brainstorming on numerous options to solve a problem, through deploying the completed solution in a production environment, you will partner with colleagues who offer a diverse set of ideas that are all immensely valuable to our purpose and mission.

What you'll Do
Communicate cross-functionally with business teams — Product, Store Operations, Fulfillment Specialist, Store & Area Managers— to source data, establish requirements and define success
Code robust, scalable, high-performance ML solutions based on massive structured and unstructured datasets from various sources
Collaborate with Engineering and Data Platform teams to build and deploy your ML models into production
Design experiments to measure the effectiveness of your product in driving a seamless fulfillment experience through key metrics such as labour rate, pick efficiency, orders ready of time, fill rate etc.
Document and share, findings and results in a structured manner with stakeholders, as well as drive technical discussions with other Data Science teams
Does this sound like you?
MS or Ph.D. in a STEM field — especially computer science — or BS plus equivalent work experience in a Data Scientist or a closely related role
A portfolio including work in the domain of data science and ML with a focus on predictive analytics, time series forecasting, operations research & supply chain optimization
Creative, resourceful, and productive problem-solver
Passion for applying data science to dynamic open-ended problems
Able to work independently and collaboratively
Comfortable with advanced SQL querying
Proficient in Python programming
Experience in shell scripting/unix
Experience with big-data tools, e.g. Spark, Beam, Kafka
Experience with Airflow for workflow scheduling
Experience with or working knowledge of a public cloud AWS, GCP, Azure
Experience with or knowledge of software development best practices
How you’ll succeed

At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning - Monetization | Ingénieur logiciel, apprentissage automatique - monétisation
job_summary: Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models | Développer des classificateurs et des…
job_description:
From making valuable connections between people and businesses to building premium services that deliver high-value experiences, the monetization organization at Meta empowers people and businesses to succeed in the global economy. As Meta focuses on building the next evolution of social experiences, the monetization team plays a crucial role in shaping the communication pathways and financial tools that all sized businesses, especially small to medium ones, need to thrive in the new digital economic environment. And we achieve that from end-to-end product and technology innovation.As a Machine Learning Engineer on the monetization team at Meta, you can help build cutting-edge full-stack technologies that will transform the way people and businesses connect and communicate. You’ll help develop industry-leading solutions that power next-generation, large-scale platforms and AI services to help connect billions of people around the world.-Qu'il s'agisse d'établir des relations précieuses entre les personnes et les entreprises ou de créer des services de qualité supérieure qui offrent des expériences de haute valeur, l'organisation de monétisation de Meta permet aux entreprises et particuliers de réussir dans l'économie mondiale. Alors que Meta se concentre sur la construction de la prochaine évolution des expériences sociales, l'équipe de monétisation joue un rôle crucial dans l'élaboration des voies de communication et d'outils financiers dont toutes les entreprises, en particulier les petites et moyennes, ont besoin pour prospérer dans le nouvel environnement économique numérique. Et nous y parvenons en innovant de bout en bout en matière de produits et de technologies.En tant qu'ingénieur en apprentissage automatique au sein de l'équipe de monétisation de Meta, vous pouvez aider à développer des technologies de pointe qui transformeront la façon dont les gens et les entreprises se connectent et communiquent. Vous contribuerez à développer des solutions de pointe qui alimentent des plateformes de nouvelle génération à grande échelle et des services d'IA pour faciliter la connexion des milliards de personnes à travers le monde.

Software Engineer, Machine Learning - Monetization | Ingénieur logiciel, apprentissage automatique - monétisation Responsibilities:

Leading projects or small teams of people to help them unblock, advocating for ML excellence | Diriger des projets ou de petites équipes de personnes pour les aider à se débloquer, en préconisant l'excellence au language ML.
Adapt standard machine learning methods to best exploit modern parallel environments (e.g. distributed clusters, multicore SMP, and GPU) | Adapter les méthodes standard d'apprentissage automatique pour exploiter au mieux les environnements parallèles modernes (par exemple, grappes distribuées, SMP multicœurs et GPU)
Develop highly scalable classifiers and tools leveraging machine learning, data regression, and rules based models | Développer des classificateurs et des outils hautement évolutifs en s'appuyant sur l'apprentissage automatique, la régression des données et les modèles basés sur des règles
Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create effective feature roadmaps | Proposer, recueillir et synthétiser les besoins et créer des feuilles de route efficaces pour les fonctionnalités.
Code deliverables in tandem with the engineering team | Coder les livrables en collaboration avec l’équipe d’ingénierie

Minimum Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in software engineering or a relevant field. 3+ years of experience if you have a PhD | Cinq ans et plus d'expérience en ingénierie logicielle ou dans un domaine connexe. Trois ans et plus d'expérience si vous êtes titulaire d'un doctorat.
1+ years of experience in one or more of the following areas: machine learning, recommendation systems, pattern recognition, data mining, artificial intelligence, or a related technical field | Au moins 1 ans d'expérience dans un ou plusieurs des domaines suivants : Apprentissage automatique, systèmes de recommandation, reconnaissance de formes, exploitation des données, intelligence artificielle ou domaine technique connexe.
Experience with developing machine learning models at scale from inception to business impact | Expérience en développement de modèles d’apprentissage automatique à grande échelle, de la création jusqu’à l'incidence sur les activités commerciales
Knowledge developing and debugging in C/C++ and Java, or experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl, PHP, and/or shell scripts | Connaissance en développement et débogage en C/C++ et Java, ou expérience des langages de script tels que Python, Perl, PHP ou des scripts shell
Track record of setting technical direction for a team, driving consensus and successful cross-functional partnerships | Expérience en matière d'orientation technique d'une équipe, de recherche de consensus et de partenariats interfonctionnels réussis.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. | Licence en informatique, en génie informatique, dans un domaine technique pertinent, ou expérience pratique équivalente.

Preferred Qualifications:
Masters degree or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical field | Maîtrise ou doctorat en informatique ou dans un domaine technique connexe
Exposure to architectural patterns of large scale software applications | Exposition aux modèles architecturaux d'applications logicielles à grande échelle

title: Principal Applied Scientist, Sponsored Products
job_summary: PhD in Computer Science, Statistics or related field. 10+ years of applied ML experience in deploying ML solutions to customer facing products.
job_description:
PhD in Computer Science, Statistics or related field.10+ years of applied ML experience in deploying ML solutions to customer facing products.2+ years hands-on experience leading multiple ML teams to design products that satisfy a customer need.Track record of delivering large-scale and high-quality ML solutions.Experience in taking on & using ML to deliver on business goals.
Amazon is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business and we are responsible for defining and delivering a collection of self-service performance advertising products that drive discovery and sales. Our products are strategically important to our Retail and Marketplace businesses driving long term growth. We deliver billions of ad impressions and millions of clicks daily and are breaking fresh ground to create world-class products. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun-loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.

The Detail page Ad experience team in Sponsored Products organization is responsible for measuring and improving shoppers experience in detail page context. We build advanced deep-learning models, large-scale machine-learning (ML) pipelines, and real-time serving infra to determine the relevance of ads with immediate detail page context, widgets the ads are served and shoppers’ intent on all devices in all marketplaces. Through precise estimation of ad relevance and their long-term value, we aim to drive optimal ads allocation and pricing, and help to deliver a relevant, engaging and delightful ads experience to Amazon shoppers. As the business and the complexity of various new initiatives we take continues to grow, we are looking for energetic, entrepreneurial, and self-driven science leaders to join the team.

Key job responsibilities

As a Principal Applied Scientist in the team, you will:
Define evaluation methods and metrics that measures shoppers experience (e.g., ad relevance), and invent scientifically sound and scalable solutions in the detail page context that improves SP detail page shopper experience.Seek to understand in depth the Sponsored Products offering at Amazon and identify areas of opportunities to grow our business via principled ML solutions.Mentor and guide the applied scientists in our organization and hold us to a high standard of technical rigor and excellence in ML.Design and lead organization wide ML roadmaps to help our Amazon shoppers have a delightful shopping experience while creating long term value for our sellers.Work with our engineering partners and draw upon your experience to meet latency and other system constraints.Identify untapped, high-risk technical and scientific directions, and simulate new research directions that you will drive to completion and deliver.Be responsible for communicating our ML innovations to the broader internal & external scientific community.
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Toronto, ON, CAN

Experience in shipping large-scale deep learning models for online recommendation, personalization, or search.Experience partnering with engineering teams to ensure deep learning solutions meet latency requirements.Experience in influencing product strategy through cutting edge research in deep learning.Evidence of producing internal or external publications that motivate new lines of research.Excellent verbal and written communication.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics
job_summary: Strong awareness of data best practices and what's possible with rich data. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize…
job_description:
Position Title: Director, Global Finance Performance Analytics

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 22651

JOB PURPOSE: McCain is on a digital transformation journey and we are seeking a creative, courageous and data-driven individual to help shape and realize our vision for Finance. The primary purpose of this leadership role is to own how Finance Digital Technologies and Analytics will enable global business performance and profitable growth decision-making.

This role is responsible for driving how dynamic financial information, analysis and planning processes, can be improved using digital and data strategies/technology. This role will be the Finance lead shaping the analytics performance roadmap in Finance, partnering with technology, global and regional Finance teams. The role will set and own the global standard for transforming financial data into business performance information for decision-making.

In this role, the incumbent will serve as Finance Business partner to Sales, Marketing, Manufacturing, Supply Chain and Agriculture functions to provide data analysis and insights, and recommend action plans to maximize the bottom line, leveraging diverse data sources.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Identify opportunities for descriptive and advanced analytics to drive profitability, provide financial understanding and direction to our business
Manage the development and sustainment of Profitability, Costing and Financial Planning models, analytical reporting, scorecards and dashboards
Set strategy and roadmap for how Digital Technologies, Financial Data and Analytics will be leveraged by Global and Regional Finance teams at McCain to enable rich financial information
Promote and drive the use of data and adoption of data analytics to Global and Regional teams to inform business decisions
Guide the continuous improvement of FP&A, Management Reporting and Profitability Analysis solutions in OneStream, SAP PaPM and SAP Analytics Cloud
Elevate and promote the use of SAP ERP, Management Reporting, Financial Planning Tools (OneStream, SAC, PaPM) and Analytics and their application with regional teams and key stakeholders, including c-level executives
Leverage diverse data sources to provide regular analytics insights, reporting and actionable recommendations to the FLT and other key stakeholders
Work in partnership with Finance, Technology and Data & Analytics teams locally and globally.

KEY PRIORITIES:
Drive continuous improvement strategy for finance to modernize how financial data information is used in a dynamic setting for business decision making
Simplify the current reporting processes to leverage more technology.
Identify opportunities to utilize existing and new data sources to identify relevant trends and propose actionable recommendations
Prioritize key reports and analysis that are essential to driving insight for profitable growth
Develop dashboards and reports that offer new insights and track metrics relevant to business performance
Work with Technology team to rapidly scale, modernize and automate reporting tools
extract from big data the meaningful trend, and propose actionable recommendations
Support user training and promote use of data and adoption of
Build a backlog of new reports and dashboards to accelerate manual reporting activities, or provide necessary data to key business decision makers
Implementation of Digital Technologies and Business Processes
Collaborate with Technology, Global and Regional Finance, Sales, Supply Chain, HR and external implementation partners to ensure a globally aligned and efficient continuous improvement of finance performance management needs
Liaise and translate the regional McCain team's requirements and expectations
Business partnership
Strategic financial partner to Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture functions
Provide insights about opportunities to maximize revenue, minimize cost and increase operational efficiency to drive the bottom line
Accountable for identifying decisions worth making with data, framing them (including defining metrics and key assumptions), and proposing actionable recommendations

MEASURES OF SUCCESS:
Simplification of the reporting/budgeting processes by leveraging more technology
Implementation and adoption of best practice Finance processes and Digital Technology
Transformation of how we utilize data science and analysis at McCain Foods
Team Engagement (both at corporate level and regional level)

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Bachelor's Degree, CPA (preferred)
5-7 years working with data to drive decision making and strategy; with a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in a large, global organization
Experience in translating data use cases, requirements to Data Science/IT teams and translating results into insights for the business
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Knowledge and expertise in SAP Finance modules and tools and how they integrate with Sales, Procurement, Manufacturing and Logistics processes
Strong awareness of data best practices and what's possible with rich data
Excellent communication skills and ability to build compelling narratives with data
Experience with requirement analysis (interviewing, facilitation, gap analysis, data analysis, business process mapping, user interface design and mock-up)
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
Experience implementing best practice Finance business processes and driving new, innovative internal concepts or products to completion
Effective project management skills
Minimum three years of experience working with Financial Planning, BI and data visualization tools (e.g., OneStream, SAC and Power BI strongly preferred)
Experience in food industry, CPG or manufacturing, ideally in the Finance function

KEY COMPETENCIES:
Collaboration, Champions Change, Drives Results

CANDIDATE PROFILE:
Strategic, results-focused individual who has a love of best practices and data and is someone who embraces change and continuous improvement. This individual has a demonstrated history of driving transformational change in data/digital.

Proven leadership abilities. This individual will be known for their experience in leading a team through transformation change. The candidate will have led a team of peers and/or external suppliers through a high-profile, business-building initiative, demonstrating a persistence and patience that is unwavering in the face of obstacles. Furthermore, the candidate will have demonstrated skills in the delivery of multiple projects concurrently, with the demonstrated ability to prioritize within a changing business environment.
Strategic change skills. The successful candidate will be a leader in bringing fresh ideas and curiosity to drive the use of digital technology and analytics in our business; leading change and innovation in this area. They will be an individual who values diversity of perspective. They will be data-driven, solutions-oriented with a proven ability to synthesize data from multiple sources and to provide actionable insights to the business based on the story the data tells. The successful candidate will demonstrate an entrepreneurial flair and a tendency to thrive in environments with broad flexibility and scope.
Strong collaboration, relationship-building and people development skills. The successful candidate is known for their ability to build strong partnerships with a variety of stakeholders – senior management peers, functional reports, suppliers and customers. They will be able to utilize their working relationships in order to garner new ideas and improve implementation. Must be able to roll up sleeves and get into details as needed.

OTHER INFORMATION

Key internal relationships: Commercial, Marketing, Manufacturing, Agriculture, HR Leaders. Global and regional Finance teams. FLT engagement. Global Technology partners. Global and Regional Data and Analytics leads.
Travel: as required
Job is primarily performed in a standard office environment

The above information indicates the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy
