title: ANALYTICS ENGINEER
job_summary: As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our data transformation layer, ensuring data quality, and optimizing data…
job_description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.

You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!

Why work with Compass Digital? We are a member of Compass Group North America the leading foodservice and support services company. We create remarkable customer experiences through the innovative design and development of technology products and services. Compass Digital began as an innovation startup and the team has since rapidly grown and now supports technology and innovation across all of North America. Compass digital is comprised of user experience designers, developers, data scientists, project managers, business analysts, marketers and technology implementation managers, all of whom look at the world from a human perspective to rethink what's possible in the areas of technology innovation and consumer engagement within the foodservice and hospitality industries. Join us.

Job Summary

As an Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our data transformation layer, ensuring data quality, and optimizing data pipelines for our analytics and data science teams. You will work closely with our cross-functional teams to ensure that our data is accurate, reliable, and accessible. You will also be responsible for identifying opportunities to improve our data infrastructure and recommending new technologies and tools.

Now, if you were to come on board as one of our Analytics Engineer, we’d ask you to do the following for us:

Develop and maintain data transformation pipelines using dbt to support our analytics and data science teams
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of our data by implementing data quality checks and processes
Optimize data pipelines for performance and scalability, ensuring that our data is accessible and usable for our cross-functional teams
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve data-related problems and provide insights on data infrastructure improvements
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues and work to resolve them in a timely manner
Develop and maintain technical documentation for our data infrastructure, including data models, schema definitions, and transformation processes

Think you have what it takes to be our Analytics Engineer? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you’ll be successful in the role.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
3+ years of experience in analytics engineering
Strong programming skills in SQL and Python, experience with dbt is a bonus
Experience with data modeling, database design, and data warehousing concepts
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen attention to detail
Strong communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment

Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

title: Senior Product Manager, Automation & Machine Learning
job_summary: This role will be focused on automating funding flows, capital planning processes and building human facing UIs. Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity.
job_description:
At Ripple, we’re building a world where value moves like information does today. It’s big, it’s bold, and we’re already doing it. Through our crypto solutions for financial institutions, businesses, governments and developers, we are improving the global financial system and creating greater economic fairness and opportunity for more people, in more places around the world. And we get to do the best work of our career and grow our skills surrounded by colleagues who have our backs.

If you’re ready to see your impact and unlock incredible career growth opportunities, join us, and build real world value.

THE WORK:
We are looking for a product manager to join our team charged with determining and delivering optimal liquidity for every customer in the world in a cost-effective, robust and scalable manner. This role will be focused on automating funding flows, capital planning processes and building human facing UIs. In addition you will support Machine Learning efforts to forecast supply and demand across digital assets to dramatically simplify and improve access to liquidity. Successful candidates must have a strong understanding of workflow automation, and utilize machine learning to understand and optimize processes going through the automation pipeline.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:
Define product requirements and manage delivery of core workflows for automation and machine learning
Be a thought leader on best practices and technical solutions for automation of business critical processes
Engage with stakeholders and actors utilizing current systems to gather requirements and drive adoption of future state products
Set a high bar of technical excellence, building solutions that are self-healing, robust and reliable
Intake, prioritize and manage the backlog for multiple products and stakeholders
Manage working relationships across multiple liquidity engineering and product teams that rely on this platform to deliver for our customers
Lead the full cycle of product development and rollout — from requirements gathering and prioritization, to design and oversight of implementation

WHAT YOU'LL BRING:
8+ years of experience in product management, with 2+ years of experience with automation experience
Ability to concisely articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences in both written and verbal contexts
Experience partnering with engineering teams to establish a shared vision, and then delivering incrementally without sacrificing long-term thinking

Nice to haves:
Prior experience working at a cryptocurrency company or general familiarity with crypto/ blockchain

Prior experience working at a fintech, payments, or trading company

Prior experience with Machine learning and forecasting

WHO WE ARE:
Do Your Best Work

The opportunity to build in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact. A professional development budget to support other modes of learning.
Thrive in an environment where no matter what race, ethnicity, gender, origin, or culture they identify with, every employee is a respected, valued, and empowered part of the team.
Ripple is Flexible First: you have the option to work from home, from our offices, or a combination of the two around our centers of gravity (15 global offices).
Weekly all-company meeting - business updates and ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
We come together for moments that matter which include team offsites, team bonding activities, happy hours and more!

Take Control of Your Finances

Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity
Competitive benefits that cover physical and mental healthcare, retirement, family forming, and family support
Employee giving match
Mobile phone stipend

Take Care of Yourself

Twice a quarter R&R days so you can rest and recharge
Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite & virtual programming
Generous vacation policy - work with your manager to take time off when you need it
Industry-leading parental leave policies. Family planning benefits.
Catered lunches, fully-stocked kitchens with premium snacks/beverages, and plenty of fun events

Benefits listed above are for full-time employees.

Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer- Price Freeze (100% remote)
job_summary: Has experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Amplitude, Big Query). Has a proven track record of solving complex problems with in depth understanding…
job_description:
About the job

In this role you will be part of a cross-functional team of product managers, designers, and engineers in the creation of data-driven Fintech products that make travel planning easier and deliver them to millions of users.

This role has a tremendous impact on the vision and success of the company. It's a unique opportunity to join one of the most innovative teams, get access to fascinating and massive data sets with market and behavioral data, a huge personal growth trajectory, and a high potential upside of pre-IPO stock options.

We are looking for someone who has a real bias for action, takes ownership, thrives on autonomy and delivers results. A smart creative with a proven record of solving hard problems and deep understanding of data, product and business.

An Ideal candidate has:
Coding abilities with languages like Python, SQL, etc.
Strong problem-solving skills, and critical thinking competencies
Statistics Commercial Awareness (works backwards from making money to the business)
Industry experience (e.g. Booking, Uber, Lyft, google, Facebook, Zillow etc)
Has deployed ML algorithms into production using latest technologies (i.e. Docker, Kubernetes, etc)
Has a proven track record of solving complex problems with in depth understanding of data, product and business impact
Has experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Amplitude, Big Query)

Perks of working with us:
Well-funded and proven startup with large ambitions, competitive salary and stock options
Unlimited PTO
WeWork All Access Pass OR Work-from-home stipend
Entrepreneurial culture where pushing limits and taking risks is everyday business
Open communication with management and company leadership
Small, dynamic teams = massive impact
100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance plans
Access to a Retirement Savings Plan
More about Hopper

At Hopper, we are on a mission to become the world’s best — and most fun — place to book travel. By leveraging massive amounts of data, advanced machine learning algorithms, Hopper combines its world-class travel agency offering with proprietary fintech products to help customers spend less and travel better. Ranked the third largest online travel agency in North America, the app has been downloaded nearly 80 million times and continues to gain market share globally.

Here are just a few stats that demonstrate the company’s recent growth:

Hopper sold around $4 billion in travel and travel fintech in 2022, up nearly 3X over 2021. In 2022, Hopper increased its revenue 2.5X year-over year.The company’s bespoke fintech products, such as Flight Disruption Guarantee and Price Freeze, now represent 30-40% of Hopper’s total app revenue.Given the success of its fintech products, Hopper launched a B2B initiative called Hopper Cloud in late 2021. Through this partnership program, any travel provider (airlines, hotels, banks, travel agencies, etc.) can integrate and seamlessly distribute Hopper’s fintech or travel inventory. As its first Hopper Cloud partnership, Hopper partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders.Hopper partnered with Capital One to co-develop Capital One Travel, a new travel portal designed specifically for cardholders.Recognized as one of the world’s most innovative companies by Fast Company four years in a row, Hopper has been downloaded over 80 million times and continues to have millions of new installs each month.Hopper has raised over $700 million USD of private capital and is backed by some of the largest institutional investors and banks in the world. Hopper is primed to continue its acceleration as the world’s fastest-growing mobile-first travel marketplace.
Come take off with us!

title: Lead Data Scientist (DL & AI Modeling, Forecasting) (Canada)
job_summary: Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic, and scalable models seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products. Data Visualization in Tableau/PowerBI.
job_description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Scientists to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. Our employees bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.

We are looking for a robust Lead Data Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. who holds solid knowledge of deep learning, is a quick learner, and has strong coding capabilities. This person will be responsible for leading the POD and managing the stakeholder engagement as well as writing complex production-level codes.

Key Responsibilities

Effectively communicate the analytics approach and how it will meet and address objectives to business partners.
Advocate and educate on the value of data-driven decision-making; focus on the “how and why” of solutions.
Lead analytic approaches; integrate solutions collaboratively into applications and tools with data engineers, business leads, analysts, and developers.
Create repeatable, interpretable, dynamic, and scalable models seamlessly incorporated into analytic data products.
Collaborate, coach, and learn with a growing team of experienced Data Scientists.
Stay connected with external sources of ideas through conferences and community engagements.
Support demands from regulators, investor relations, etc., to develop innovative solutions to meet objectives utilizing cutting-edge techniques and tools.

Requirements

Ph.D. (highly preferred) or Master in Statistics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 5-7+ years of extensive Data Science experience with super deep knowledge in AI, and DL modeling coding capability as this person needs to make designs happen.
Strong statistics foundation and knowledge of statistical packages. Proficiency with Python and SQL and ability to write complex Python codes and SQL queries.
A solid knowledge of deep learning, quick learner, and a strong coding capability. This person will be responsible for writing complex production-level codes.
Hands-on experience building models is a must.
Experience with demand forecasting and/or supply chain/retail forecasting is a must.
Data Visualization in Tableau/PowerBI
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills to understand business partner needs and deliver solutions.

Benefits

This position offers an excellent opportunity for significant career development in a fast-growing and challenging entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of individual responsibility.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Retail Media Platform
job_summary: Strong experience with building data science and machine learning solutions. Experience with data viz tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
job_description:
At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer on our team, you will use an abundance of data from the Loblaw enterprise in order to build machine learning solutions. Your team will collaborate with business stakeholders and engineers within Loblaw Digital to deliver models to production that help in driving our Ecommerce business including Search, Recommendations, Media and Supply Chain optimization. You will design experiments to measure your success with KPIs that include adoption, conversion & retention. You will use data every single day to uncover meaningful insights that inform your experimentation strategy and ultimately, your product roadmap.

What you’ll do
Build robust, scalable, high performance Prediction, optimization and Recommendation ML solutions based on massive structured and unstructured data from various sources
Collaborate with ML platform and product engineers to build scalable and efficient machine learning systems in the production environment
Work cross-functionally with product and business teams on new innovative features for ad targeting and bidding to optimize advertisement performance as well as gather data and requirement and define success
Provide mentorship to other members of the team
Represent the team with technical leadership in collaborations with other software development teams
Does this sound like you?
MS or PhD in a STEM field — especially computer science — or equivalent work experience in a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer or closely related role
Strong experience with building data science and machine learning solutions
Creative, resourceful, and productive problem-solver
Able to work independently and collaboratively
Passion for building ML solutions to fluid, open-ended problems
Experience in software development best practices
Previous experience building large scale Search Models as well as ranking/recommendation systems
Previous experience working in Adtech is a plus
Comfortable with advanced SQL querying
Proficient in Python and familiar with a compiled language
Experience with big-data tools, e.g. Spark, Beam, Kafka.
Experience with data viz tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc.
#LI-BT

How you’ll succeed

At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!

Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.

title: Senior Manager, Marketing Data & Analytics
job_summary: Proficient in data retrieval, structuring and visualization to ensure we can amalgamate disparate data sets into a cohesive view.
job_description:
If you are looking to join one of Canada’s fastest growing companies, goeasy Ltd. is the place for you! Certified as a Great Place to Work®, recognized among Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures, GTA's Top 100 Employers, one of Canada’s Top 50 Fintechs, North America’s Most Engaged Workplaces, and placed on the 2022 Report on Business Women Lead Here list, we want the best and brightest to join our team.

We are a publicly traded company on the TSX with over 4000% shareholder return since 2001. Accredited by the Better Business Bureau, goeasy Ltd is a Canadian company that provides non-prime leasing and lending services through easyhome, easyfinancial, and LendCare.

We’re seeking a Senior Manager, Marketing Data and Analytics that is a passionate data-oriented problem solver. You are relentless in unlocking marketing insights from complex and often disparate data sets, have a strong business background, and a customer first focus. In this role, you will report to the Director, Digital Performance Marketing and work closely with internal teams within Marketing, Business Intelligence, and Risk and Analytics. Your primary responsibility will be reporting and analyzing performance of our marketing channels (e.g., Google, Meta, organic digital, email, web, and other emerging digital channels) and key marketing segments. You will be leading a team (one direct report) that is laser focused on the performance and the impact of optimizations on our campaigns and promotions, continually providing recommendations to improve our marketing effectiveness. Core responsibilities also include leading our marketing data and analytics strategy and ensuring we’re leveraging first and third-party data to drive profitability and new customer growth.

This is a hybrid that role requires onsite presence at our Mississauga office, with the option to work at our downtown Toronto office as well.

Job Responsibilities:
Lead a measurement and reporting strategy that enables the organization to leverage actionable insights that optimize marketing channel and data performance
Lead a team that provides daily, weekly, monthly and post-campaign reports for internal stakeholders including managing ad hoc requests and maintaining data visualization and dashboarding tools
Run a marketing data and analytics function that services the Marketing team and the organization more broadly, providing stakeholders with support in their day-to-day duties including campaign insights and analytics to ensure key KPIs are being met
Develop and implement a multi-touch attribution strategy that allows us to understand marketing channel performance across the entire customer journey to ensure we’re making the right investments to drive profitability and new customer growth
Oversee the implementation of Google Analytics 4 and Google Analytics 360 to ensure we have the right technology in-place to enhance our analytical capabilities and sophistication
Work closely with our BI and Risk and Analytics teams to identify opportunities and methods to leverage our first party data to better reach existing customers and identify valuable prospects
Develop and deliver on a marketing data and analytics technology roadmap to ensure we have the right platforms and vendors given our unique needs and business challenges
Continually lead the organization in the analysis of market trends, enabling us to capitalize on opportunities as the occur in real-time
Work directly with external partners – e.g., Google, Salesforce etc. – to ensure we’re getting the most out of our investments, leveraging the ‘multiplier effect’ that partners with scale can bring to our business
Build out forecasting models that clearly lay-out our digital growth metrics on an annual basis with the flexibility to make ongoing adjustments based on external (i.e., market demand, competition) and internal (i.e., budget, channel mix) factors
Manage a performance-oriented team of one subject matter expert that is able to distill complex data and information sets into straightforward and actionable insights at both the working group and executive level

Qualifications:
5-7 years of relevant experience in the marketing data and analytics field with a primary focus on digital
A post-secondary degree in data science, marketing analytics, commerce, or related field
Experience and deep understanding of digital media (e.g., programmatic, paid search, web, social etc.) and CRM data sets is a must
Demonstrated experience building out a multi-touch, cross-channel, attribution strategy to ensure we have the right channel mix, contributing to an overreaching media mix model
Proficient in data retrieval, structuring and visualization to ensure we can amalgamate disparate data sets into a cohesive view
Knowledge of and experience with Google Analytics 4, Google Analytics 360s and Advanced MS Excel (formulas, pivot tables, v-lookups)
Understanding of Sales Force Marketing Cloud, Tableau and Salesforce CRM considered a valuable asset
The ability to surface and simply explain insights that have been derived from complex data sets
A deeply curious and critical thinker that is motivated by unanswered questions and the drive to solve them through creative and transparent methods
A self-starter that identifies opportunities where data and analytics help to solve real business problems
Ability to work in a very fast-paced and dynamic team environment, with a willingness to pivot as the needs of the business change and evolve.
Demonstrated ability to build out accurate and detailed forecasting models to ensure the team is meeting growth targets
Excellent problem solving and technical troubleshooting skills

Diversity, Inclusion, and Equal Opportunity Employment:
At goeasy, we believe that we can only be the best when people are able to bring their best selves to work every day. This means that we are committed to cultivating and preserving a work culture where we celebrate who we are, where everyone feels seen and heard and where every employee can fulfill their potential. As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing accommodations for applicants upon request at any stage of the recruitment process in accordance with all legislative requirements throughout Canada. Please let us know if you require an accommodation during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Additional Information:
All candidates considered for hire must successfully pass a criminal background check, credit check, and validation of their work experience to qualify for hire. We thank all interested applicants, however we will only be contacting those for interview who possess the skills and qualifications outlined above.

Why should you work for goeasy?

To learn more about our great company please click the links below:

http://goeasy.com/careers/

#LI-HYBRID

title: Sr. Actuarial Analyst, Claims Analytics
job_summary: Contribute significantly to Aviva Canada’s overall strategy against Fraud and Financial Crime through the curation of claims fraud data, its analysis, and the…
job_description:
Individually we are people, but together we are Aviva. Individually these are just words, but together they are our Values – Care, Commitment, Community, and Confidence.

Traditional actuarial work has always been complex, rigorous and challenging. For that reason, actuaries have typically worked behind the scenes to make products as complicated as insurance policies run smoothly. But what if you were given the opportunity to work directly with the business and the operations? To work with pace, contribute to meaningful, value-adding projects, and help shape the way we work as a company by using data to tell stories, or by building predictive models that influence how we operate and prioritize our work?

Aviva Canada is looking for a hard-working individual interested in joining the Financial Crime & Operational Analytics Team within Claims. This role is open for Actuarial Analyst, Senior Actuarial Analyst and Actuarial Team Lead, depending on the individual's qualifications and experience. The applicant will work in a dynamic environment and gain exposure across a broad spectrum of actuarial and data science disciplines, while also working directly with the business and the operations.

Does this excite you? Read on!

What You'll do:
Analyze the financial results of Aviva Canada’s claims business through the application of standard actuarial techniques and predictive modelling using various machine learning techniques

Quantify emerging risks through actuarial means to assist in influencing and directing Aviva Canada’s Claims initiatives

Build, deploy and maintain predictive models designed to identify one-off opportunistic fraud in our Claims and Policy spaces as well as more over-arching sophisticated, organized financial crime affecting Aviva Canada at a higher level

Contribute significantly to Aviva Canada’s overall strategy against Fraud and Financial Crime through the curation of claims fraud data, its analysis, and the delivery of any associated predictive modelling

Collaborate and build close relationships with company-wide partners in various areas of the business, including Corporate Actuarial, Finance, Pricing, Underwriting and Risk

What you'll bring:
Degree in actuarial science, mathematics or related field;

Minimum 3 years of full-time Actuarial experience;

Actively pursuing actuarial exams and successfully passing Exam 5 is an asset;

Strong team player who is also able to work independently;

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills - ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with other departments;

Strong analytic and problem-solving skills with the ability to work through the technical implementation details while appreciating the big picture;

Strong technical knowledge of MS Excel and VBA;

Experience with Python and SQL and SAS an asset.

What you’ll get:
Compelling rewards package including base salary, eligibility for annual bonus, paid vacation, retirement savings, share plan, health benefits, personal wellness account, and 3 paid volunteer days per year.

Our vacation package starts at 4 weeks !

Outstanding Career Development

Paid professional development education (Controlled Insurance Program designation)

Corporate wellness programs to support our employees’ physical and mental health

Aviva Canada has an accommodation process in place to provide accommodations for employees with disabilities. If upon commencement of employment you require a specific accommodation because of a disability, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner so that an appropriate accommodation can be arranged. This process applies throughout your career with Aviva Canada.

title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations
job_summary: Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data.
job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.
Partner with key stakeholders to address their unique needs to drive performance and support exploring ‘how-to’ best utilize data to achieve outcomes; selection of the right KPIs for new initiatives and storytelling of the data after launch
Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.
Some of what you need:
Post-secondary degree/diploma or the equivalent relevant working experienceBachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, CRM product ownership, reporting, analytics or data managementPowerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look for answers that go beyond the data.Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).Expert oral and written communication skills; senior executive to sales manager levelProficient in SQL and experience with big data sets in a cloud environmentExperience with MS Office (Excel and Power point)Proven skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, communication and decision-makingDeep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and considerations with ability to share this understanding with othersFlexibility to adjust and thrive in an environment with changing requirements, schedules and priorities for multiple projects or assignments.Quickly learn, synthesize and simplify information for other's consumptionWork on multiple, simultaneous programs that require both strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical executionStrong Business to business (B2B) knowledge an asset
Some of what you will get:
Associate discountHealth and Dental benefitsRRSP/DPSPPerformance bonusesLearning & Development programsAnd more...

title: Manager, Data Analytics (Portfolio Risk Management)
job_summary: You will create and harness Moneris data to build accurate data analytics, dashboards and risk tools. Applying research and investigations of existing Moneris…
job_description:
Your Moneris Career - The Opportunity

The Manager, Portfolio Management Data Analytics is a strategic partner role at Moneris. You will have oversight on the usage of Moneris financial, payments risk, credit ratings and credit bureau data to lead efficiency and support Risk Management decisions with statistical thoughtfulness. You will be a strategic enabler supporting different teams across the organization with a focus on Enterprise Risk in their analytical and reporting requirements. Strategic goals include building analytical tools with advanced analytics that measure numerous risk indicators and outcomes driven from machine learning to support decision-making. Risks include acquiring, funding advance risks, credit and fraud exposures. The role requires direct partnership with Sales, Operations, Finance, Technology and external partners such as: Third-party Acquirers, Credit reporting agencies and bureaus. You will create and harness Moneris data to build accurate data analytics, dashboards and risk tools.

Location: You will be based in our Toronto office and will work in a Hybrid model.

Reporting Relationship : You will report to VP, Merchant Portfolio Risk Management.

Your Moneris Career - What you'll do

Portfolio Management focused operational lead in Data Analytics – The manager must lead his team and the risk management subject matter experts SME's by providing analytics and insights to allow the business to achieve growth and cost efficiencies to achieve targets.

Implement a broad range of requests including leading advanced analytics projects that incorporate all areas of Moneris Risk Management.

Identify insights that are useful and bring these to the attention of risk owner(s).

Service all Moneris portfolio risk management team ensuring they have adequate, relevant information they require to run the business.

Build Models using statistical methods, programming, and business knowledge.

Lead and use analytics and insights improve the performance and ease of use of Moneris data.

Identify industry insights, business trends, macro-economics to provide opportunity for Moneris to improve the optimization of resource allocation and decisioning to manage risk.

You will be a significant partner of Enterprise Risk-focused Corporate Data Definitions to work with all areas of Moneris.

As a direct partner with Data Governance and Technology the Manager ensures data definitions are used in operationalized reports, tools and dashboards within the governance framework.

Perform routine reconciliation activities of all Enterprise Risk-focused data.

Design an audit methodology and conduct audits, which measure data quality and verify usability of the data, and going through all reports historically built to ensure compliance.

Collaborate and partner with teams and departments to explore and capture opportunities to use data science and analysis to deliver incremental profit and efficiencies.

Relationship manage work to assist different areas across Moneris to support decision-making while considering appropriate Risks, costs, and return based financial analysis.

Use and expand data products. Applying research and investigations of existing Moneris wide and Enterprise Risk data to evolve Moneris data offerings. Applying new and the latest methodologies to create new data products, tools to manage risk.

Work with Data Platforms, Sales and Partners-Product teams to implement models that will be used for operational and risk management purposes to support product offerings. Also, identify reoccurring requests/reports which can be automated and work with Data Platforms to implement.

Stay informed about new technologies and issues in data science, including current technologies, platforms, standards, methodologies, and ethical guidelines.

Lead discussions on Moneris data products and analytical capabilities with external parties. Partner with Moneris approved external vendors, Moneris Product-Partners, Technology and manages expectations. Establish timelines, determine feasibility, and advocate best practices regarding Moneris risk management.

Use and stay adept with data market trends to lead insights to guide Portfolio Management leadership to build hypotheses and make recommendations that facilitate our decisions around strategic opportunities to support Moneris risk management and loss provision targets.

Lead development of business and market insight capabilities through analytics to constructively challenge paradigms, promote important performance drivers and identify opportunities to capture growth.

Evaluate business intelligence to ensure data products (internal and external) are on par with industry standards.

Some main technical responsibilities include: identifying terms, ensuring terms are clearly defined, the source of data is identified and verified before being adopted across Moneris.

Lead the Risk Management data analytics team

Your Moneris Career - What you bring

University degree required (or equivalent work experience may be considered a substitution)

5 or more years' experience in data analysis (work in finance/risk management ideal)

At least one year experience in people management

R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, Power BI

2 or more years’ experience working with Cloud providers (Azure, AWS, etc.)

Relevant experience with Big Data, PySpark & Databricks

Experience with Moody's KMV, Personal and Commercial Bureau and rating agency data

Previous experience in the payment industry considered an asset

Bilingualism is an asset

Experience with statistical modeling/data analyses, regression

Expert with quantitative methods, and ability to work with different data sources, experience with relational databases

Strong abilities with financial planning, modelling, forecasting, and analysis

Understanding of aggregating broad financials for reporting, planning and forecasting experiences, management reporting and analysis, model maintenance and build/development within Excel (Ability to navigate quickly and maintain Excel models).

Your Moneris Career - What you get

Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits plans starting from Day 1

RRSP matching and defined contribution pension plan

Learning & development programs and resources including unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning, Coursera and an Educational Assistance Program

Holistic approach to your well-being, with an Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, monthly wellness events and a supportive workplace culture

Company-wide paid year-end closure and personal time off (including religious, personal, and volunteer days)

Find out more about the work perks and benefits you get as a Moneris employee at Moneris.com/careers

title: Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations
job_summary: Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data.
job_description:
: 1260941

Who we are
We, at Staples Professional, provide our business customers with a deep professional expertise when it comes to Business Essentials, Furniture, Facilities, Technology, Print/Promo, and Pack and Ship, as well as next-day delivery service and customized solutions for ordering, billing and reporting. We are part of the Staples umbrella in Canada, and as such we are a true multi-channel solution provider – online, at our customers place of business and in-store, for all our customers needs. We are looking for people who are curious, passionate and put the customer first.

We are building an inclusive and diverse team
Staples Professional is creating an inclusive and diverse work environment. We welcome, value and thrive on perspectives and contributions from backgrounds that vary by race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lifestyle, age, educational background, national origin, religion or physical ability. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Some of what you will do:
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Sales Operations and Customer Service, the Sr. Manager, Business Intelligence & Sales Operations will develop and execute the strategy, priorities, and direction of our recently formed team. Lead the design and execution of best-in-class dashboards and scorecards to bring on-time, accurate visibility across all team in Staples Professional.

Supporting multiple functions, (sales, customer service, marketing, supply chain & senior leadership), in Staples Professional and across Staples Canada, the candidate will enable data-driven decision making which will be used to answer key relevant questions about business performance, drive sales growth, expand lines of business and improve profitability across small to enterprise-sized accounts. The individual will be a hands-on leader, working with their teams to visualize data which will tell compelling stories, creating a bias for action. They will lead BI, Data Governance and CRM projects, in support of analytics- and CRM-product roadmaps.

We are on a Next-Generation Sales and Customer Service 3-year journey where new technology and processes, powered by AI/ML, will accelerate our go-to market strategy, and supercharge our B2B customer experience. This is a highly visible role that requires being able to link analytics to business implications to form actionable, high-impact recommendations that drive revenue growth & reduce seller friction. A strong understanding of a sales-led SaaS model - both motions and metrics - is key.

To be their authentic self each day, they thrive on leading change, collaborating across teams, inspiring people, are highly motivated and are a die-hard for analytics. The work environment is ever-changing, and agile so the ideal candidate would demonstrate resiliency, prioritization, and be passionate about the customer experience.

Specifically, You Will:
BI Intelligence & Data Governance - 60%
Sales Operations - 40%

Develop short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic, business performance and operational objectives; Building and maintaining scorecards, dashboards that can be leveraged across Staples Professional and Staples Canada.
Partner with key stakeholders to address their unique needs to drive performance and support exploring ‘how-to’ best utilize data to achieve outcomes; selection of the right KPIs for new initiatives and storytelling of the data after launch
Act as a leader in data governance to ensure metrics are consistent across Staples Professional to ensure confidence and integrity in data. Key partners include Finance, Data Science, IT, and Sales Leadership.
Working with the Data Science team, leverage unified 360 view of customers to deliver customer health reporting, insights, and drive a customer data narrative across all aspects of Staples Professional
Leverage the relationship with technology and SaaS vendors to bring thought-leaders and best- practice into Staples Professional
Collaborate with the CRM Centre of Excellence, IT, 3rd party Integrators and software vendors to lead, develop and design the SFDC, sales ops and other sales enablement tools roadmap.
Facilitate alignment and collaboration across sales, pricing, sales enablement, and marketing, to directly affect Staples Professional’s revenue and customer experience.
Responsible for technical activities, enablement and user adoption associated with Staples Professional’s day-to-day sales & service tools: SFDC, HighSpot etc. Measure, monitor and improve tool utilization.
Build-out automated process flows and seller motions to maximize revenue and penetration potential of markets (white space, adjacent products, new business)

Leadership
Motivate, mentor, and ensure your direct team has the right tools, processes, and principles in place to deliver work that is on time and to support partner needsLead a continuous learning environment with respect to utilizing the latest methodologies, technologies, and illustrative best practices to tell stories which can drive business decisionsDevelop a community where associates are energized, with an ownership mindset, that enable each other to be better every day, and extend that support across all teams.
Some of what you need:
Post-secondary degree/diploma or the equivalent relevant working experienceBachelor degree in Marketing, Business, Computer Science or similar fields5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence, CRM product ownership, reporting, analytics or data managementPowerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look for answers that go beyond the data.Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).Expert oral and written communication skills; senior executive to sales manager levelProficient in SQL and experience with big data sets in a cloud environmentExperience with MS Office (Excel and Power point)Proven skills demonstrating strong judgment, problem-solving, communication and decision-makingDeep understanding of customer success principles, approaches and considerations with ability to share this understanding with othersFlexibility to adjust and thrive in an environment with changing requirements, schedules and priorities for multiple projects or assignments.Quickly learn, synthesize and simplify information for other's consumptionWork on multiple, simultaneous programs that require both strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical executionStrong Business to business (B2B) knowledge an asset

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
job_summary: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights. Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams.
job_description:
Purpose

Drive the implementation of the new BI framework and governance policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Strategy: Support & Deliver

Governance

Maintain VGW reporting taxonomy, by updating and classifying as necessary
Document report-related activities and lifecycles across VGW data teams
Creates new reports and retrofits existing reports as part of the rollout strategy of BI related products to the new state
Follow and promote the adoption of the governance framework for VGW's Data Catalog to ensure policies, standards and definitions are followed with peer Analysts across the organisation
Become an advocate of Alation across the organisation & lead discussions
Create & review supporting documentation (Articles & Wikis) that support the rollout and adoption of the new BI framework across the organisation

Reporting

Deliver dashboard/ reporting solutions that meet user expectations and follow the new state framework & governance
Apply the new report tooling framework when developing new reports, dashboards and self-service BI tools
Review data sources & queries to determine if it is accurate or relevant for the development of VGW's Data Catalog and Business Data Dictionary
Collaborate with the Data Management team to maintain and improve the performance of data sources used as part of BI products.
Contribute to the design, development, and maintenance of scalable and reliable analytical products, dashboards, and metrics that drive VGW crucial business decisions
Provide ad-hoc support on data collection, analysis and reporting

Stakeholder Management and Team Collaboration:
Work under the direction of senior team members and escalates issues encountered after attempting to solve
Collaborate with other data team members to resolve any questions that arise in relation to VGW's Data Catalog & BI's new processes and procedures.
Summarise queries and concerns from external teams in relation to the rollout of BI's framework
Can run requirement sessions with a product or data team to discuss relevant requirements and best solutions
Can work autonomously on program components and ad-hoc analytics work, is capable of problem-solving issues that are encountered, however, understands to when to escalate blockers.
Builds and maintains positive relationships with stakeholders, and proactively identifies and addresses any issues or concerns they may have.
Clearly articulates and communicates insights to stakeholders.

Learning & Development:
Mentor and provide support to associates BI in best practices and technical optimisation
Support the execution of L&D programs for BI-related tooling (Data Catalog & Tableau) and proficient SQL skills
Work with direct reports to build comprehensive personal learning and development plans to deepen technical or social tracks and broaden skill sets on underdeveloped areas that will add value to VGW and enable career progression
Encourage diverse opinions and problem-solving from a variety of sources that differ from your personal context and background
Provide broad growth impact, through internal skill shares, public user groups, blog posts or similar.

Qualifications, skills & experience:
A Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Engineering, Data Science or Artificial Intelligence.
2+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or data insights
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to create and review queries.
Business acumen
Experience working with BI analysts, data analysts, and/or cross-functional teams.
Problem-solving skills to identify pain points and recurring concerns.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Personal Competencies:
Delivers results. Works tenaciously toward and derives satisfaction from achieving challenging goals; pitches in where required without regard to status. Self-disciplined; measures progress and evaluates results; prevents irrelevant issues or distractions from interfering with the timely completion of important initiatives.
Interpersonal skills. Demonstrates clear, professional, and respectful communication in all interactions, consistent with an inclusive work environment. Treats others with dignity and respect. The team isn't just better for having you; the others are better by having you
Pursues excellence. Dedicates required time and energy to assignments or tasks to ensure that no aspect of the work is neglected; works to overcome obstacles to completing tasks or assignments. Raises the bar, and helps others reach it too.
Applied learning. Readily absorbs and comprehends new information from formal and informal learning experiences.
Embraces change. Actively tries to understand changes in work tasks, situations, and environment as well as the logic or basis for change; actively seeks information about new work situations.
Teamwork and collaboration. Adheres to the team's expectations and guidelines; fulfils team responsibilities; demonstrates personal commitment to the team.

VGW Canada Inc. is committed to building an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workplace. By learning from each other's differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. VGW Canada Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please advise our Talent Acquisition Specialist in advance should accommodation be required. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
